--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: What You Should Know about MRSA and Deadly Hospital Acquired Infections
BASENAME: know-mrsa-deadly-hospital-acquired-infections
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 07/08/2016 03:58:30 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-4940" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/What-You-Should-Know-about-MRSA-and-Deadly-Hospital-Acquired-Infections-300x225.jpg" alt="What You Should Know about MRSA and Deadly Hospital Acquired Infections" width="300" height="225">Methicillin-resistant&#xA0;<em>Staphylococcus aureus</em>, or MRSA, is a dangerous antibiotic-resistant bacterium than can lead to a number of serious, even deadly complications. Like c. diff, MRSA is often contracted by patients in hospitals, and is therefore commonly referred to as a hospital acquired infection, or HAI.

A MRSA infection is a staph infection; staph is usually found on the skin, or in or around the nose. It is a highly contagious bacterial infection, which is why antibiotics are necessary to clear it up. MRSA, however, is a strain that is immune to certain antibiotics, which means doctors must find another way to treat the infection. Sometimes that involves using different medications than one might normally prescribe; sometimes it involves draining the infection site.
<h2>Symptoms of MRSA infections</h2>
In the beginning, a MRSA infection &#x201C;generally starts as swollen, painful red bumps that might resemble pimples or spider bites,&#x201D; <a href="http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/mrsa/basics/symptoms/con-20024479">according to the Mayo Clinic</a>. Over time, those little bumps can fill with pus, or turn into painful abscesses that require draining. The site of the infection is often warm to the touch, and patients may develop a fever.

If the infection is left untreated, the MRSA bacteria can &#x201C;burrow&#x201D; into the body. This can lead to serious complications by spreading the infection to:
<ul>
    <li>Your bloodstream</li>
    <li>Your organs, including the heart or lungs</li>
    <li>Your joints</li>
    <li>Your bones</li>
</ul>
It can also develop into pneumonia or sepsis, a complication associated with blood infections that causes <a href="http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/sepsis/home/ovc-20169784">inflammatory responses</a> throughout the body. Unchecked, sepsis can lead to septic shock, cause numerous body systems to fail, or even result in death.
<h2>Common HAIs outside of MRSA</h2>
MRSA, however, is not the only hospital acquired infection; in fact, it is not even the most common HAI. That list, according to the <a href="http://www.cdc.gov/hai/surveillance/">Centers for Disease Control and Prevention</a>, includes illnesses such as:
<ul>
    <li>Pneumonia</li>
    <li>diff, and other gastrointestinal infections</li>
    <li>Urinary tract infections</li>
    <li>Infections at surgical sites</li>
    <li>Central line infections caused by the used of catheters</li>
    <li>Primary bloodstream infections</li>
</ul>
<a href="http://www.courier-journal.com/story/life/wellness/2015/07/28/hospitals-get-poor-marks-avoiding-infections/30805551/">Kentucky hospitals in particular</a> struggle to prevent and control the spread of infections like MRSA and C. diff, both of which are highly contagious, and which are most dangerous to the very group of people most likely to contract them &#x2013; sick people. In comparison, Ohio hospitals&#x2019; number of reported HAIs are <a href="https://www.cdc.gov/hai/pdfs/stateplans/factsheets/oh.pdf">significantly lower</a> than the national baseline&#x2019;s, according to the CDC.

When MRSA is detected, contained and treated, the symptoms can clear up within weeks &#x2013; sometimes even within days. When it is left untreated, however, it can spread to others easily, and can lead to the death of the patient. At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we hold negligent health care providers accountable when they fail to diagnose MRSA in a timely manner, or when their actions have directly led to the spread of the infection. To find out more about what our medical malpractice attorneys in Kentucky and Ohio can do to help you, please call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, or use our contact form to request a time for a free consultation.

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Do I Have a Valid Medical Malpractice Case?
BASENAME: valid-medical-malpractice-case
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/02/2016 03:39:44 PM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/nJdPljJhof4" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

It depends on the facts of your case, but there are a couple of guidelines that apply to every case, in terms of determining whether or not that case should be pursued. First we look at whether or not the doctor or nurse involved acted unreasonably, and if they acted unreasonably then that first element that we&#x2019;re looking for is satisfied&#x2026;.&#x201D;

We also look to see if there are sufficient recoverable damages in the case to justify the high expenses of litigation. In other words, even if there was malpractice, by the time we reach a settlement or verdict, will the expenses exceed the reasonable value of the person&#x2019;s injuries? This is the information we relay to you from the beginning, so you can always make informed decisions about your case.

The only way to know if you have a valid medical malpractice case is to contact experienced legal counsel. The experienced legal team at Crandall &amp; Pera Law has defended healthcare companies and their insurance companies in the past. Our knowledge of the inner workings of the healthcare system is invaluable in establishing the facts of your case. Our team includes not only highly qualified trial attorneys, but also three Registered Nurses who evaluate medical malpractice cases from the perspective of healthcare providers.

Our team has the range of experience and knowledge you need to successfully pursue a medical malpractice claim. If you believe that you or your loved one has been a victim of medical malpractice, contact our Ohio or Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys today. We will evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. For a free consultation, call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, or contact us today.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: What Is a Medical Negligence Claim?
BASENAME: medical-negligence-claim
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 07/26/2016 03:28:27 PM
-----
BODY:
It&apos;s actually three things; it&apos;s proving the standard of care, proximate causation, and damages. Crandall &amp; Pera Law will analyze your medical records and hire independent medical experts to prove what the standard of care is, and that your physician failed to meet the standard of care. But our evaluation does not stop there &#x2013; we also have to prove what is called proximate cause.

Here&apos;s a quick example of proximate cause. If you&apos;re in a car and you go up to a stop sign, you are supposed to stop at the sign. If you don&apos;t and you go through the sign, then you were negligent. But if you go through the sign and don&apos;t hit anyone, then you have not proximately caused any damages. If you go to the stop sign in your car and you go through it, and you hit a car and injure individuals, then your negligence has proximately caused damages.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law will hire independent experts to evaluate proximate cause, and ensure that we prove that too.

Lastly, we have to prove damages. The types of damages that we see in medical negligence cases include death, scarring and disfigurement, and brain damage. If you have any other questions, or would like a free consultation on medical negligence, nursing home, commercial trucking or personal injury, feel free to send us an email, sent us a request on an online chat or contact us at either our Ohio or Kentucky numbers.
<h2>Medical negligence is more likely than ever</h2>
Recent studies have documented a chilling statistic; <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2016/05/03/researchers-medical-errors-now-third-leading-cause-of-death-in-united-states/">medical errors are now the third leading cause of death in the United States</a>. Calculations estimate that medical errors kill nearly 251,000 people each year, a number that continues to grow. Worst of all, the rate of medical errors has not changed in nearly 16 years despite the continuing progress of medical research. When the rate of population growth is factored in, we see that the number of medical errors has actually increased year on year for more than decade.

These are sobering statistics. A September 2015 report from the <a href="http://www8.nationalacademies.org/onpinews/newsitem.aspx?RecordID=21794">Institute of Medicine</a> found that most people suffer at least one wrong medical diagnosis in their life. As our population ages and more and more patients are treated by a flawed healthcare system, these numbers will only increase. In short, the likelihood that your loved one will be the victim of medical negligence increases all the time.

When your loved one is a victim of medical negligence, it can be difficult to know what to do. Mounting medical bills, declining health, and constant doctors visits create confusion and cause emotional turmoil. Consulting experienced legal counsel can cut through the complex issues and help you and your family during your time of need. The compassionate legal team at Crandall &amp; Pera Law has experience fighting big healthcare and the big companies that insure them. Let our family help yours. Call 877.686.8879 or <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank" rel="noopener">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Half a Million Hoverboards Officially Recalled and Banned
BASENAME: half-million-hoverboards-officially-recalled-banned
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 07/21/2016 04:47:48 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5008" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Half-a-Million-Hoverboards-Officially-Recalled-and-Banned--200x300.jpg" alt="Half a Million Hoverboards Officially Recalled and Banned" width="200" height="300">The Consumer Product Safety Commission has had an interesting time recently handling a glut of defective products; the Ikea recall in late June affected some 29 million units, one of the largest recalls in US history. Now, the CPSC has issued recalls for multiple companies concerning some half a million &#x201C;hoverboards&#x201D; with defective battery packs. The low quality Lithium-ion batteries have a nasty habit of exploding at inopportune moments and setting fire to nearby structures.
<h2>The scope of the problem</h2>
<a href="http://www.forbes.com/sites/curtissilver/2016/07/06/cpsc-recalls-500000-hoverboards/#2b7f9873675d">Forbes</a> reported &#x201C;There have been at least 99 incidents reports of the battery packs in self-balancing scooters/hoverboards overheating, sparking, smoking, catching fire and/or exploding including reports of burn injuries and property damage. Consumers should immediately stop using these recalled products and contact the recalling company to return their hoverboard for a full refund, a free repair or a free replacement depending on the model.&#x201D;

&#xA0;

We wrote about the problems that plagued the popular toy in January, when the news broke that the low quality mass-produced Li-ion batteries that powered the devices were explosively discharging. The issue is so widespread in the toys that the US Trade Commission banned all hoverboards not manufactured by Segway in March.
<h2>What you need to know</h2>
So far, five companies account for almost 95% of the recalled units; in order, they are Swagway, Hovertrax, iMoto, Powerboard, and the Hype Roam. If you have one of these products in your home, contact the manufacturer immediately for a refund or authorized repair. The full list of the affected products is, referred to by the CPSC as self-balancing scooters, is available <a href="http://www.cpsc.gov/en/Recalls/2016/Self-Balancing-Scooters-Hoverboards-Recalled-by-10-Firms/">here</a>.

If you haven&#x2019;t been affected by these faulty battery packs, but have these products in your home, you are at risk. The likelihood of a malfunction increases each time the product is used, charged, and discharged; the risk of catastrophe only goes up over time.

If your child was injured or your property was damaged by a defective hoverboard, you may be entitled to compensation for medical bills and property damage. The experienced defective product attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. To speak to a Kentucky or Ohio defective product attorney, call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, or <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

TITLE: What Is the Statute of Limitations on a Medical Negligence Case?
BASENAME: statute-limitations-medical-negligence-case
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 07/19/2016 03:16:22 PM
-----
BODY:
The statute of limitations in medical negligence cases is very important. First of all, what does that mean? It means that you only have a certain amount of time to investigate and file your medical negligence claim. The statute of limitations generally speaking can be as short as one year in the state of Ohio. Therefore, you need to come to Crandall &amp; Pera Law to get your case investigated as soon as you possibly can.

If you have any other questions, or would like a free consultation on medical negligence, nursing home commercial trucking or personal injury, feel free to send us an email, send us a request on an online chat, or contact us on either our Ohio or Kentucky numbers.

Medical negligence cases are complicated. You, the victim, carry the burden of proof; you must establishthat a particular person made an error that caused you harm. Just getting the relevant paperwork can be a massive task; when you are injured or sick, it can be impossible.
<h2>Waiting to file could cost your case</h2>
Ohio&#x2019;s statute of limitations for filing a medical negligence claim is one year. While some circumstances may allow you to file a medical malpractice lawsuit after a year, it becomes much more difficult. The sad fact is that the legal system requires you to consider filing a claim during an emotional and confusing time. The idea can be overwhelming, but the experienced and compassionate medical negligence lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can help cut through the confusion and get your family back to normal.

If you or a loved one has been the victim of medical negligence, you may be entitled to compensation for your injuries, illness, lost wages, medical care and other expenses. Our team of experienced Ohio medical malpractice attorneys and Registered Nurses will evaluate your case and answer your questions. For a free consultation, call 877.686.8879 or <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank" rel="noopener">contact us</a> today.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Ikea&#x2019;s Failure to Meet Voluntary Safety Standards Resulted in the Largest Furniture Recall in US History
BASENAME: ikeas-failure-meet-voluntary-safety-standards-resulted-largest-furniture-recall-us-history
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/04/2016 04:55:15 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5029" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Ikea&#x2019;s-Failure-to-Meet-Voluntary-Safety-Standards-Resulted-in-the-Largest-Furniture-Recall-in-US-History-300x200.jpg" alt="Ikea&#x2019;s Failure to Meet Voluntary Safety Standards Resulted in the Largest Furniture Recall in US History" width="300" height="200">Ikea, the flat-pack furniture behemoth with a flimsy object in every home, announced the recall of 29 million chests and dressers in a deal with federal regulators. The recalled units do not conform to voluntary safety standards for furniture, which suggest that extended drawers can carry up to 50lbs of pressure before the unit begins to tip. While the lack of industry regulations played a role, the company&#x2019;s unwillingness to comply with suggested standards directly caused this massive recall.
<h2>Efficient packaging leaves no room for voluntary compliance</h2>
Ikea specializes in lightweight, affordable furniture, a niche that caters to young urbanites and college students. Unfortunately, the reduction in weight and ease of assembly that make the furniture so affordable comes at a steep cost elsewhere; namely, quality. The company&#x2019;s private mission to make everything portable, easy to carry, and easy to assemble supersedes any concerns about compliance with voluntary regulations. It&#x2019;s a simple matter of the bottom line.

The recall, issued June 28, applies to all furniture that doesn&#x2019;t meet the minimum voluntary safety standards, and binds Ikea to offer either removal of the recalled units with a full refund or installation of a wall anchor to eliminate the tipping hazard. The company sought to ward off the recall last year by offering free wall anchor kits, a step considered wildly inadequate by safety advocates because consumers remained uninformed of the risks posed by unanchored furniture.
<h2>A recall 27 years in the making</h2>
<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/29/business/ikea-recall-tip-over-furniture.html">The New York Times</a> said of the recall, &#x201C;The move by the Swedish company, the world&#x2019;s largest furniture seller, represented a crucial victory for consumer advocates in a years&#x2019; long effort to hold it accountable for a growing death toll of young children dating to 1989.&#x201D; The furniture in question has crushed seven toddlers to death in tip-over accidents and caused more than 70 injuries over the years.

When corporate culture places efficiency above product safety, families suffer needlessly. Ikea&#x2019;s failure to comply with voluntary safety guidelines placed millions at risk, and left families devastated by the untimely deaths of young children whose eagerness to explore the world spelled their demise at the hands of a faceless corporation. Consumer Product Safety Commission chairman Elliot Kaye summed up the recall concisely, telling the Times, &#x201C;That doesn&#x2019;t exonerate them [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent=&quot;yes&quot; overflow=&quot;visible&quot;][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type=&quot;1_1&quot; background_position=&quot;left top&quot; background_color=&quot;&quot; border_size=&quot;&quot; border_color=&quot;&quot; border_style=&quot;solid&quot; spacing=&quot;yes&quot; background_image=&quot;&quot; background_repeat=&quot;no-repeat&quot; padding=&quot;&quot; margin_top=&quot;0px&quot; margin_bottom=&quot;0px&quot; class=&quot;&quot; id=&quot;&quot; animation_type=&quot;&quot; animation_speed=&quot;0.3&quot; animation_direction=&quot;left&quot; hide_on_mobile=&quot;no&quot; center_content=&quot;no&quot; min_height=&quot;none&quot;][Ikea] from the past, but it is, from a consumer-safety standpoint, a positive announcement.&#x201D;

If your loved one has been injured or killed by a defective product, you may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky defective product attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. To speak to a defective product attorney, call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764 or our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Trampoline Parks Have Kids Bouncing Their Way into ERs
BASENAME: trampoline-parks-kids-bouncing-way-ers
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/09/2016 03:49:37 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5033" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Trampoline-Parks-Have-Kids-Bouncing-Their-Way-into-ERs-300x200.jpg" alt="Trampoline Parks Have Kids Bouncing Their Way into ERs" width="300" height="200">At first glance, there appear to be nine trampoline parks in Ohio. There are only three in Kentucky, but the ones in Ohio are close enough, so altogether we&#x2019;re looking at a dozen amusements parks designed to let kids bounce to their hearts&#x2019; content. If the park isn&#x2019;t your thing, though, you can always purchase your own trampoline for the backyard, or enroll in a gymnastics class, or even rent a &#x201C;bounce house&#x201D; for your little ones.

All this jumping around is wreaking havoc on our bodies, and a new report from U.S. News &amp; World Report claims that &#x201C;U.S. emergency rooms saw a 12-fold increase in the number of patients injured at trampoline parks -- from 581 in 2010, to nearly 7,000 in 2014.&#x201D; There is no doubt in our minds that those numbers will remain or even increase when we start seeing statistics for 2015 and 2016.

These are not &#x201C;minor&#x201D; injuries, either. The article goes on to say that while sprains and broken bones are the most common types of trampoline-related injuries, ERs around the country are also seeing an increase in neck and skull fractures, which can lead to TBIs. Bouncers risk injuring themselves when they fall, when they are around other kids or when they try to exit the trampolines.
<h2>Keeping your kids safe while they jump</h2>
We understand the popularity of trampoline parks: bouncing around is fun. But we also see clearly as adults that which we could not see as kids &#x2013; namely, that the &#x201C;cool&#x201D; stuff we wanted to do to emulate our friends or our favorite Olympians can be really dangerous when you don&#x2019;t know what you are doing.

If your child is a fan of trampoline parks, keep these tips in mind to keep him or her safe:
<ul>
    <li>Always supervise your children, even if they are not jumping.</li>
    <li>Do not allow your child to try stunts like flips without proper guidance from a professional, such as coach or personal trainer.</li>
    <li>Makes sure your child has plenty of room to play, and move him or her to a less crowded space if more kids join the area.</li>
    <li>Protective gear is always an option, provided it is not disallowed by the park.</li>
    <li>Keep your children away from areas where adults are jumping.</li>
</ul>
If you are still on the fence about letting your child play at a trampoline park, there is some good news: the increase in injuries only relates to the parks, so your child may see less of a risk of injury on a home trampoline (provided you follow the same safety rules).

Crandall &amp; Pera Law providers comprehensive counsel for personal injury victims throughout Ohio and Kentucky. If your child sustained an injury while playing in a trampoline park, and that injury was the result of another person&#x2019;s negligence, we may be able to help you. Call our Ohio personal injury lawyers at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky injury attorneys at 877.651.7764, or contact our office through this contact form.

TITLE: Congratulations, Steve Crandall, on Your Selection to the 2017 Edition of Best Lawyers in America&#xA9;!
BASENAME: congratulations-steve-crandall-selection-2017-edition-best-lawyers-america
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/18/2016 03:19:39 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5045" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Screen-Shot-2016-08-18-at-2.17.47-PM-300x139.png" alt="Congratulations, Steve Crandall, on Your Selection to the 2017 Edition of Best Lawyers in America&#xA9;!" width="300" height="139">Crandall &amp; Pera Law is proud to announce that our very own Steve Crandall has been selected for inclusion in the 23<sup>rd</sup> edition of the <em>Best Lawyers in America</em> publication! This is Steve&#x2019;s 3<sup>rd</sup> consecutive year being selected for his work in the areas of medical malpractice and personal injury. Being named to <a href="http://www.bestlawyers.com/"><em>Best Lawyers</em></a> is a true honor, because it is the &#x201C;oldest and most highly-respected peer review guide to the legal profession worldwide,&#x201D; and one of the few that rely solely on the opinions of not just our colleagues, but on the attorneys who face our team across the aisle every time we are in court.

This year there were more than 7.3 million nominees, which means that ultimately, fewer than 1% of all attorneys nominated for inclusion were actually selected. Here in Ohio, only a handful of attorneys were selected in the area of plaintiffs&#x2019; medical malpractice, proving once again what an extraordinary attorney Steve really is.
<h2>How the Best Lawyers process works</h2>
An attorney can be nominated for <em>Best Lawyers</em> by any third party &#x2013; colleagues, clients, judges, etc. &#x2013; and his or her work will be reviewed and evaluated by attorneys who hold the distinction of being on the list. Votes and scores are tallied, and only lawyers with the highest evaluations move on. Once they have been approved, <em>Best Lawyers</em> ensures that the nominee is in good standing with any local bar associations he or she may belong to. If the nominee is approved, then the group sends out notification to the firm.

The thing about <em>Best Lawyers</em> that is different from other objective ratings services is that inclusion one year does not guarantee inclusion the next. So while anyone nominated in 2017 will automatically be nominated in 2018, that attorney still has to prove him or herself worthy for the next publication. On top of that, an attorney cannot buy a place on the list: the only way to be selected is to earn it.

This is why we are excited for, but not at all surprised by, Steve Crandall&#x2019;s selection. His dedication to the pursuit of justice for his clients is virtually unparalleled. We could not be prouder.

Congratulations, Steve &#x2013; you deserve it!

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Keeping Passengers Safe in the Back Seat of the Car
BASENAME: keeping-passengers-safe-back-seat-car
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/11/2016 05:06:43 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5036" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Keeping-Passengers-Safe-in-the-Back-Seat-of-the-Car-300x258.jpg" alt="Keeping Passengers Safe in the Back Seat of the Car" width="300" height="258">By now, parents should know just how critically important car seats, booster seats and seat belts are. In Ohio and in Kentucky, seatbelts have been mandatory since the mid-1980s, and both states have seen their laws regarding car and booster seats evolved through the years. But for all of our talk about child safety restraints, there is significantly less discussion about just how safe the back seat really is &#x2013; for children or for adult passengers. As it turns out, the rear seat passengers may be at risk of more serious injuries than you might think.

In 2015, <a href="http://www.cbsnews.com/news/sitting-in-the-back-no-longer-the-safest-bet-for-all/">CBS News</a> reported that &#x201C;the car industry&apos;s focus has been on better protecting riders in the front because that&apos;s where most passengers, or roughly 88 percent, sit.&#x201D; Improvements have been made in airbag technology (Takata and Autoliv aside) and crumple zones, and even the design of the cars, all of which contribute to a safer drive or ride. However, the rear seats of a car or truck are not necessarily the safest place for adult passengers (even ones who wear their seatbelts). A study conducted by the Children&apos;s Hospital of Philadelphia and the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety found that adults were more likely to sustain chest injuries; that women passengers might be more at risk of a head or neck injury; and that older rear-seat passengers faced an increased risk of dying in an auto accident. According to the <a href="http://www.iihs.org/iihs/topics/t/general-statistics/fatalityfacts/passenger-vehicles/2014">IIHS&#x2019;s independent website</a>, the exact number of rear seat fatalities in 2014 were:
<ul>
    <li>429 children (under the age of 13) in the second row, 35 in the third row</li>
    <li>342 children/adults (ages 13-19) in the second row, 9 in the third row</li>
    <li>871 adults (over the age of 20) in the second row, 76 in the third row</li>
</ul>
Almost all research turns up the same information: we must always wear our seatbelts, and we should consider purchasing cars with rear and side-impact airbags and technologies. For people who cannot run out and purchase a new car, however, here are a three <a href="http://www.edmunds.com/car-safety/how-safe-are-rear-seat-passengers.html">things to remember</a> when you get in the car:
<ol>
    <li>The safest rear seat is the one in the middle, so put your children there.</li>
    <li>Passengers over the age of 55 are at a greater risk of serious injury in the back seat, so let older passengers ride up front.</li>
    <li>Use a three-point harness as opposed to just a lap belt whenever one is available.</li>
</ol>
If you or your loved one was seriously injured in an auto accident in Ohio or Kentucky, Crandall &amp; Pera Law is ready to help. Our skilled team of auto accident attorneys fights for justice for personal injury victims, so that you can have a brighter future. To learn more about what we can do, please call our Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio team at 877.686.8879, or use our contact form.

<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5076" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Screen-Shot-2016-08-29-at-1.52.36-PM-300x138.png" alt="Congratulations, Marc Pera, on Your Lifetime Achievement Award from America&#x2019;s Top 100 Attorneys&#xAE;!" width="300" height="138">Crandall &amp; Pera Law is proud to announce that co-founder Marc Pera has been selected for lifetime membership to America&#x2019;s Top 100 Attorneys&#xAE;! Membership is limited to only the top 100 attorneys in each state. Marc has been <a href="http://www.americastop100attorneys.com/featured-initial-recipients.html">selected for his work</a> on behalf of medical malpractice and personal injury victims throughout Ohio.

Being named to such a list is <a href="http://www.americastop100attorneys.com/selection-methodology.html">no small feat</a>: &#x201C;Candidates for membership are initially identified through third-party research or peer nominations by other elite attorneys in the community. Once a candidate is identified, they are carefully screened through third-party research and analysis involving proprietary algorithms applying multi-criteria decision making methods to create a Pareto efficiency frontier*.&#x201D; The algorithm is designed to review and assess, among other things and in no particular order:
<ul>
    <li>Case results</li>
    <li>Client satisfaction</li>
    <li>Collegial reputation</li>
    <li>Impact on the community</li>
    <li>Legal accomplishments</li>
    <li>Professional experience</li>
    <li>Significant accolades and news, including media notoriety</li>
</ul>
If a candidate passes muster after such an extensive review, he or she may be offered a position on the list. Fewer than 1% of all practicing attorneys in the country will be afforded this honor.
<h2>Fighting for families</h2>
While all of us are thrilled that Marc was selected, we are not surprised. Marc Pera&#x2019;s dedication to, and compassion for, his clients is well-known throughout Ohio and Kentucky. In our offices, Marc has a bit of a reputation for being the nicest one &#x2013; but don&#x2019;t let his warm demeanor and friendly attitude fool you into thinking he isn&#x2019;t one of the most aggressive trial attorneys we know. An accomplished speaker and respected Adjunct Professor at Northern Kentucky University&#x2019;s Chase School of Law, Marc Pera&#x2019;s in-depth knowledge of the laws regarding patients&#x2019; and victims&#x2019; rights is formidable. His experience as a former insurance defense attorney means he can anticipate the moves his colleagues will make (often before they even make them), allowing him to build an airtight case for his clients.

Marc is motivated by the circumstances in which his clients find themselves. He knows that for some of the people he helps, their lives and their futures are on the line. His is consistently named as one of the Top 50 or Top 100 attorneys in Ohio by objective ratings services, including Super Lawyers, National Trial Lawyers, <em>Law and Politics</em> and <em>Cincinnati Magazine</em>. He serves on multiple committees and Boards for various legal associations, all while maintaining his Superb rating on Avvo and running the Cincinnati and Dayton offices of Crandall &amp; Pera Law.

No, we are not surprised by Marc&#x2019;s most recent award, though we are tickled to think he&#x2019;s reached &#x201C;Lifetime Achievement&#x201D; status. After all, as anyone who knows Marc can tell you, he&#x2019;s nowhere close to done yet.

Congratulations, Marc, on this most recent honor. You deserve it!

* &#x201C;Pareto&apos;s Efficiency&#x201D; is an economic term, used in this description to describe the abilities of the company&#x2019;s algorithm. You can <a href="http://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pareto-efficiency.asp">learn more about it here</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Signs of Birth Injury
BASENAME: signs-birth-injury
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/23/2016 02:18:18 PM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5VdJoQJismY" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
<div class="page-outer"></div>
<div class="page-outer">
<div id="Page2" class="page loading">
<div class="layer text">
<div class="tb">

The signs of birth injury can occur immediately, such as when a child is delivered and requires resuscitation, or they can appear when a child is two or three years old and they&#x2019;re missing their developmental milestones, such as walking, talking or being able to feed themselves.

In both instances, an immediate investigation should be undertaken in order to allow us to get all of the medical records and ensure the hospital can provide the records before too much time has elapsed. In reality, the statute of limitations for a birth injury case expires on that child&#x2019;s 19<sup>th</sup> birthday, but you would never want to wait that long, simply because if I make a request immediately, I have a higher chance of getting those records to do the best investigation for you and your family.

&#xA0;

The birth of your child is supposed to a milestone in your life and a happy occasion for all. When healthcare professionals are negligent and your child is injured during birth, a happy occasion can be marred by the reality that your child faces a lifetime of medical care and assistance because of a professional mistake.

Birth injuries take many forms; some injuries occur because your delivery team made a bad decision that put your child in jeopardy. Others are more direct, like forceps and vacuum extractor injuries. Your baby needs constant monitoring before, during, and after labor. When medical professionals make mistakes at this crucial time, families are affected forever.

Birth injury isn&#x2019;t always straightforward, and proving that a birth injury was the result of medical negligence even three years after the fact can be difficult. The legal team at Crandall &amp; Pera Law has worked on both sides of these cases; we know what tactics healthcare providers and their insurers have at their disposal. Our experience gives you a better chance of winning a verdict or settlement that will help your family lead the best life they can.

If you believe that your child was the victim of a birth injury, you may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio birth injury lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, or contact us today for a free consultation.

</div>
</div>
</div>

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Nursing Home Negligence Cases
BASENAME: nursing-home-negligence-cases
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 08/25/2016 03:14:18 PM
-----
BODY:
If somebody were to ask me what are some of the elements that we consider when deciding whether or not to bring a case against a nursing home, I would explain to an individual that one of the primary factors that we look for is whether or not an individual has been abused and neglected.

In a nursing home setting, it&#x2019;s really quite different than the traditional malpractice, medical malpractice case, because the individuals in a nursing home are there for extended periods of time. And these individuals, often because they are at the end of life, have lost their independence. They are dependent upon the nursing home personnel to take care of all of their needs.

Oftentimes these people are unable to communicate whether those needs are being met or neglected. So when you look at a nursing home case, it&#x2019;s usually not a &#x201C;gotcha&#x201D; moment, here&#x2019;s a malpractice; it&#x2019;s more you have to look over the course of time &#x2013; weeks, months, and analyze the records to see if the person has been neglected, to see if they have been systematically abused over that period of time.

Oftentimes we see situations where people have developed bedsores that get worse and worse, and that can be indicative that the personnel at the nursing home weren&#x2019;t turning this person. In other words, moving them so they weren&#x2019;t sitting on the same place or lying on the same place of the body. Or that they&#x2019;re malnourished; they&#x2019;re not being given the food and nourishment they need to keep themselves healthy so that these sores don&#x2019;t develop.

Oftentimes we see in the records a deterioration of a person&#x2019;s mental status, and it&#x2019;s because they&#x2019;re not getting adequate nutrition or they&#x2019;re not getting the medications that doctors have prescribed to help keep them as healthy as possible. You have to look at these cases &#x2013; and usually there are thousands of pages of medical records &#x2013; very, very carefully. And that is something that Crandall &amp; Pera Law has the staff and the expertise to do as well as anybody.

We have nurses and lawyers that specialize in looking at nursing home cases and analyzing these records to determine whether abuse and neglect has occurred. Oftentimes, we don&#x2019;t get the real picture until a person leaves the nursing home, goes to another medical institution, and documents how resident truly appears, and oftentimes by then it&#x2019;s too late for that person.

Now, because people in nursing homes are at the end of life, they don&#x2019;t have lost income. They weren&#x2019;t looking at having 30 or 40 years and having children. They were at the end of life, so compensatory damages typically aren&#x2019;t that great in a nursing home case. They&#x2019;re not that high because the person didn&#x2019;t have much life left. Typically, in nursing home cases, we have an element of punitive damages. Because these nursing homes are owned by multi-billion dollar corporations, they are looking at a bottom line, and when we see signs of abuse and neglect in a resident, what we often find is that a nursing home is understaffed, and they don&#x2019;t have the proper staff to take care of a person&#x2019;s unique needs.

And they don&#x2019;t have that staff because, at a very high level, a corporate executive has made the decision that that nursing home doesn&#x2019;t need those extra funds, and the nursing home cuts staff. In the end, they cut care and your loved one is neglected or abused. At that point, when we find evidence of that, then we go to the court and we say look, we want punitive damages because this corporation needs to understand this cannot be tolerated. If we couldn&#x2019;t get punitive damages and it was just compensatory damages, it would just be a cost of doing business.

So if you believe a loved one of yours has been abused or neglected in a nursing home, give us a call at Crandall &amp; Pera Law. We will take a look at the case and give you an honest and educated opinion as to whether that has occurred. Oftentimes it hasn&#x2019;t, and people are at the end of life and they do deteriorate and die. But if you have any questions, give us a call and we will give you our opinion.

Nursing home negligence is a sad reality in Kentucky. It can be difficult for our aging loved ones to defend themselves or stand up for their rights, especially in the controlled environment of a long-term care facility. Nursing home negligence takes many forms, and proving that a healthcare provider was negligent can be time-consuming and difficult.

The elderly are at higher risk of abuse because they are easy targets. Your frail and forgetful loved one can be the victim of any kind of abuse, ranging from basic neglect to emotional, physical, financial, and even sexual abuse. Protecting you and your family from further harm is our first priority at Crandall &amp; Pera Law; serving justice is our mission.

The experienced Kentucky nursing home abuse and neglect attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can be your advocates during a difficult time. Our team of former healthcare defense attorneys and registered nurses can evaluate the circumstances of your loved ones care quickly and effectively.

If you believe that your loved one has been the victim of nursing home abuse or neglect, our Kentucky nursing home abuse attorneys can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: When Is a Uterine Rupture the Result of Medical Negligence?
BASENAME: uterine-rupture-result-medical-negligence
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 09/01/2016 02:47:44 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5083" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/When-Is-a-Uterine-Rupture-the-Result-of-Medical-Negligence-300x200.jpg" alt="When Is a Uterine Rupture the Result of Medical Negligence?" width="300" height="200">Expecting mothers have a lot on their plates, so they rely on their OB/GYN, midwives and nurses to help keep them safe from risks. One of those risks is uterine rupture, which occurs when the walls of the uterus tear. It usually occurs at the incision site of a previous C-section, so mothers who wish to deliver their additional children naturally must be on the lookout.

Uterine tears are not necessarily caused by medical negligence in and of themselves &#x2013; but failing to warn a pregnant woman about her chances of sustaining the injury, and failing to adhere to a proper monitoring schedule, certainly are. Without the right care, a mother and her child can be at serious risk of injury.
<h2>Understanding the causes of uterine ruptures</h2>
Most women who suffer a uterine tear have had some kind of surgical procedure, with C-sections being the most common. However, if you have had fibroids removed, or had any kind of surgery on your uterus, you could be at increased risk. You might also experience a rupture if you sustained injuries in a car accident, or had to undergo an external cephalic version because your baby was in the breech position, or if the doctor made an error while using forceps in your previous delivery.

In some rare cases, a woman who has never had any procedures may also sustain a rupture. Women who have had multiple pregnancies or are carrying multiple babies, or whose labor has been prolonged, may also be injured.
<h2>Determining an act of obstetrical malpractice</h2>
<p class="p1">As we said earlier, the rupture itself is not usually the result of negligence (though failure to perform a C-section may be), but that does not mean that your doctor is not liable if you sustain an injury. Although there are other signs that may alert doctors and nurses to the possibility of a uterine rupture, they are not present in all cases, therefore, the most important sign is an abnormality in your baby&#x2019;s heart rate indicating fetal distress. Other signs may include:</p>

<ul class="ul1">
    <li class="li1">Pain</li>
    <li class="li1">Vaginal bleeding</li>
    <li class="li1">Labor progress stops</li>
    <li class="li1">Rapid pulse</li>
    <li class="li1">Symptoms of shock</li>
</ul>
<p class="p1">If you have undergone a C-section but are now attempting a vaginal birth, your OB/GYN and his or her team must constantly monitor the fetal heart rate. Failure to do so may lead to a delay in diagnosis.</p>
<p class="p1">Furthermore, it is your doctor&#x2019;s duty to inform you of the risks of giving birth naturally after you have had a C-section, especially because the increase risk of a rupture. Failure to diagnose a rupture can lead to</p>

<ul class="ul1">
    <li class="li1">Severe blood loss and shock for the mother</li>
    <li class="li1">Hysterectomy (removal of the uterus) if the uterus cannot be repaired</li>
    <li class="li1">Lack of oxygen and blood supply for the baby</li>
</ul>
<p class="p1">A uterine rupture is a life-threatening situation for both the mother and her baby. The only treatment is immediate C-section in order to save the lives of mom and baby.</p>
<span style="line-height: 1.5;">The labor and delivery process can be complicated enough without the risk of additional injuries. A delay in diagnosis, a failure to monitor or inform, or the delay of a C-section can lead to permanent injuries &#x2013; to you or your baby. At</span> Crandall &amp; Pera Law<span style="line-height: 1.5;">, we protect the rights of families whose doctors have failed to live up to their duty of care. To speak with an experienced birth injury attorney in </span>Kentucky<span style="line-height: 1.5;"> or </span>Ohio<span style="line-height: 1.5;">, please call </span>877.651.7764<span style="line-height: 1.5;"> (Kentucky), </span>877.686.8879<span style="line-height: 1.5;"> (Ohio), or use our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.</span>

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Why Commercial Truck Accidents Almost Always Involve Fatigued Drivers
BASENAME: commercial-truck-accidents-almost-always-involve-fatigued-drivers
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 09/08/2016 02:54:35 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5100" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Why-Commercial-Truck-Accidents-Almost-Always-Involve-Fatigued-Drivers-300x236.jpg" alt="Why Commercial Truck Accidents Almost Always Involve Fatigued Drivers" width="300" height="236">The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration announced a federal rule last year that will require the use of electronic logging devices to track truck driver duty status by December 2017. The use of electronic logging devices in place of written logs will increase log accuracy and driver accountability, and will prevent companies from interrupting drivers on mandated rest periods. The goal of the rule is to reduce the rate of commercial truck accidents resulting from overworked and fatigued drivers.

This <a href="http://www.overdriveonline.com/e-log-mandate-set-to-take-effect-dec-2017-rule-to-be-published-by-fmcsa-friday/">measure</a> is meant to enforce policies that have been enacted over the years, including a 2011 rule that changed the &#x201C;hours of service&#x201D; rules for truck drivers. That rule required a 30-minute break during the first 8 hours on the road and updated how a 34-hour &#x201C;restart&#x201D; rest period was used. It effectively reduced the maximum number of hours that commercial drivers spend on the road from 82 to 70 per week.
<h2>Why fatigue is so dangerous</h2>
According to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration:

&#x201C;Drowsy driving is a form of impaired driving that negatively affects a person&#x2019;s ability to drive safely. Most people associate impaired driving with alcohol or drugs, but in this situation, sleepiness is the primary cause. Drowsy driving is not just falling asleep at the wheel. Driver alertness, attention, reaction time, judgment and decision-making are all compromised leading to a greater chance of crashing. According to NHTSA&#x2019;s National Motor Vehicle Crash Causation Study (NMVCCS), drowsy drivers involved in a crash are twice as likely to make performance errors as compared to drivers who are not fatigued. In extreme cases, a drowsy driver may fall asleep at the wheel.&#x201D;

A 2016 report from the <a href="https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/03/160310125330.htm">National Academy of Sciences</a> estimates that 10 to 20% of approximately 4,000 fatalities resulting from truck and bus crashes every year involved fatigued drivers. There is no test for drowsiness, so the true number of accidents caused by drowsy driving is unknown; estimates range from 5,000 to 8,000 deaths resulting from around 1.2 million crashes each year, but the numbers could be much higher.
<h2>Why has it taken so long enforce mandated rest periods?</h2>
The hours of service rules were changed in 2011, but with paper logs and the push for more money, the accuracy of self-reporting was highly suspect. By the time e-logs are required, six years will have elapsed between the reduction of hours on the road and an accurate method of enforcement. The simple explanation is that the National Transportation Safety Board, which studies traffic crashes, programs, and technologies, has no regulatory whatsoever. The board can simply make recommendations to regulatory agencies, which <a href="http://www.overdriveonline.com/action-on-driver-fatigue-health-distractions-among-ntsbs-2016-most-wanted-regulations/">it does often</a> and to seemingly little effect.

To illustrate just how often the agency is ignored, <a href="http://www.myajc.com/news/news/transportation/technology-that-could-curb-truck-deaths-is-mired-i/npRNN/">consider this</a>: the NTSB recommended that the Department of Transportation investigate a new collision avoidance technology and determine whether the device could reduce accidents. The recommendation was to make the life-saving technology mandatory in commercial vehicles if it was determined to be effective. That recommendation was made <em>over twenty years ago</em>, in 1995<em>.</em> Last November, the House Rules Committee refused to amend a transportation policy bill to mandate the technology in commercial trucks, despite its growing prevalence in passenger vehicles.

The refusal of government agencies to implement life-saving technologies despite proof of effectiveness verges on criminal. Thousands of lives have been needlessly lost, and families will continue to suffer until these issues are properly addressed. At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we fight for the rights of accident victims every day. If you or a loved one was injured in a commercial truck crash, you may be entitled to compensation for your injuries and property damage. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio commercial truck accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. To speak to a commercial truck accident attorney in Kentucky, please call 877.651.7764; for our Ohio legal team, please call 877.686.8879, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

&#xA0;

&#xA0;

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Dealing with the Aftermath of an Injury While You Are on Vacation
BASENAME: dealing-aftermath-injury-vacation
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 09/13/2016 12:27:44 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5103" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Dealing-with-the-Aftermath-of-an-Injury-While-You-Are-on-Vacation-300x200.jpg" alt="Dealing with the Aftermath of an Injury While You Are on Vacation" width="300" height="200">Now that the weather has gotten a little cooler, many people will start thinking about taking their final vacations of the year. Maybe you are renting a home at a lake, or planning on eating your way through Tuscany, or counting down the days until you sail off to the islands on a cruise. No matter what kind of vacation you planned, you may find yourself facing serious complications if you are injured while on vacation.

The very first thing you should do if you sustain an injury, or come down with an illness, is to seek medical attention. Your medical records will be a vital part of any claim for compensation, regardless of whether you go to trial or work out a settlement. You should also file a police report, no matter which country you are in, as you will need it to corroborate your claim.
<h2>What about insurance?</h2>
If you are traveling within the U.S., and you get into an auto accident, then your car insurance should protect you. Your health insurance may also cover a portion of the costs for your care at an out-of-state hospital. But what if you are traveling by sea or by air, or if you are going abroad?

One way you can help protect yourself is by purchasing travel insurance. Depending on the package you purchase (and from whom you purchase it), you could be covered for everything from lost luggage to travel assistance to medical expenses. If you are renting a car, take the added insurance package offered from the rental company, just in case.
<h2>Complications while at sea</h2>
If your big summer plans include a cruise, please remember that transport vessels are subject to maritime (or Admiralty) laws &#x2013; a very complex and specific area of the law. Be sure to review your contract before you sign on to see if you are prohibited from filing a claim in the event of a medical emergency, or if the statute of limitations to file that claim are different than they are in your home state. For example, in Kentucky you generally have <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MYLq62bkOqc" target="_blank" rel="noopener">one year from the date</a> that the injury occurred (or should have been discovered through reasonable care) to file a medical malpractice claim; Ohio also <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tNDpb0AYiUU" target="_blank" rel="noopener">gives you one year</a>, though there are exceptions for this time limit in both cases. If you are subject to medical negligence on a cruise ship, you may have far less time.

Keep this in mind, too: when you are vacationing on a resort, on a cruise or in another country, it can be virtually impossible to track down witnesses to your injury in the weeks following your return home. If you can get other tourists to give statements to the police, do so. Otherwise, ask their permission to record their accounts on your phone, laptop or tablet, and keep those files safe so your personal injury attorney can hear them. Exchange information with the witnesses and whomever caused your injury if possible.

Whether you vacation locally or across the world, you want to be prepared in case the worst happens. If you do sustain an injury while on vacation, you can trust the skilled Kentucky and Ohio personal injury attorneys of Crandall &amp; Pera Law to look out for your best interests. To find out more about what we do, or to schedule a free consultation at one of our office locations, please call our Ohio team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, or fill out this contact form.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Multi-Truck Collision on I-80 Puts Two People in the Hospital
BASENAME: multi-truck-collision-80-puts-two-people-hospital
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 09/22/2016 02:01:11 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5117" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Multi-Truck-Collision-on-I-80-Puts-Two-People-in-the-Hospital-300x135.jpg" alt="Multi-Truck Collision on I-80 Puts Two People in the Hospital" width="300" height="135">Most of the time, when we talk about multi-vehicle accidents, we mean multiple passengers cars, trucks or SUVs. On September 17, 2016, however, three semi-trucks ended up crashing into one another. <a href="http://wkbn.com/2016/09/17/multi-vehicle-crash-closes-part-of-interstate-80/">WKBN 27</a> quoted Ohio State Highway Patrol Sgt. Tom Homrighausen as saying &#x201C;One vehicle that was in the right lane struck the vehicle in the left lane, causing both vehicles to hydroplane, cross the medians into the westbound lanes of traffic. As they did, they both overturned,&#x201D; and then a third truck &#x2013; which tried to brake in time but could not &#x2013; ended up colliding with the first two vehicles and breaking open the trailer.

Miraculously, only two of the people involved in the accident sustained injuries: truck driver Duane Borgelt of Beaverdam, Ohio and Mississippi resident James Van Norman, who was a passenger in Borgelt&#x2019;s truck. The initial cause of the accident is still unknown (WFMJ says they &#x201C;<a href="http://www.wfmj.com/story/33121382/i-80-westbound-closed-at-the-ohio-pennsylvania-line">tapped</a>&#x201D; each other), though the driver of the third truck, Samuel Magee, &#x201C;was issued a failure to control citation.&#x201D;
<h2>A bad accident that could have been much, much worse</h2>
Commercial truck accidents are serious business. In the I-80 crash this weekend, the force of their hit was enough to flip both trucks onto their sides. Had such a collision involved passenger vehicles, the chances are good that more people would have ended up in the hospital with injuries. An accident with a commercial truck on a busy Ohio interstate like I-80 could lead to:
<ul>
    <li>Spinal cord injuries, including partial or full paralysis</li>
    <li>Traumatic brain injuries</li>
    <li>Neck and skull fractures</li>
    <li>Organ and soft tissue damage</li>
    <li>Loss of limb</li>
    <li>Permanent loss of vision and hearing</li>
</ul>
Under the most tragic circumstances, drivers or passengers could have died in such an accident.

The news report cites Sgt. Homrighausen as saying the trucks hydroplaned &#x2013; which means the I-80 was wet, at least in the area of Hubbard. If there was enough water on the ground, it could have hidden potholes, missing pieces of tarmac or uneven roadway, and there may have been debris in the road that was difficult to see. Between the poor weather conditions and the almost inevitable panic that would have set in as the driver lost control, the truck accident could have been far worse.

We wish the injured driver and passenger a speedy recovery.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law handles complex commercial truck accident claims in Ohio and Kentucky. If you or your loved one sustained an injury in a collision with a semi-truck, we want to hear your story. You can reach our Ohio truck accident attorneys by calling 877.686.8879, or Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, or you can use our contact form to learn more.

&#xA0;

&#xA0;

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Trial vs. Settlement: How Do You Know Is the Best Option for You after an Auto Accident?
BASENAME: trial-vs-settlement-know-best-option-auto-accident
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 09/15/2016 11:21:39 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5106" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Trial-vs.-Settlement-How-Do-You-Know-Is-the-Best-Option-for-You-after-an-Auto-Accident-300x201.jpg" alt="Trial vs. Settlement- How Do You Know Is the Best Option for You after an Auto Accident?" width="300" height="201">The ride-sharing service Uber has been in the news quite a bit over the past few years, as <a href="http://money.cnn.com/2016/08/11/technology/uber-lawsuits/index.html?iid=EL">drivers filed lawsuits</a> regarding their pay, their safety and the company&#x2019;s overall policies. In April, Uber offered to pay $100 million to settle two class action lawsuits filed by drivers in California and Massachusetts, who &#x201C;charged that the drivers should be treated as employees, rather than independent contractors. That would have entitled the drivers to a variety of benefits, including overtime and health insurance. It also might have put Uber on the hook for some of the drivers&#x2019; expenses, such as gas and tolls,&#x201D; as reported by <a href="http://money.cnn.com/2016/08/19/technology/uber-drivers-class-action-settlement/">CNN.com</a>.

A federal judge has rejected the settlement offer, claiming the amount was too little to properly compensate the drivers. In his order, Judge Edward Chen claimed that &quot;The court cannot find that the settlement is fair and adequate,&quot; as the majority of plaintiffs would have received fewer than $100 a piece from the settlement. Uber will need to either revise its settlement amount, or the cases will have to go to trial.

This decision &#x2013; go to trial or settle the case &#x2013; is one that all auto accident victims may have to face eventually. It is not an easy decision to make, either: most of the time, you or your loved one has just sustained an injury, is facing mounting medical bills and potential lost wages, and may be dealing with the extensive loss of personal property, or the tragedy of losing a loved one. As auto accident attorneys, one of our duties is to explain to you the pros and cons of a settlement and of a trial, and to advise you about your realistic options and expectations for both. While class action lawsuits are different from individual lawsuits, ultimately the plaintiffs must decide what is best for them and their futures, and proceed from there.
<h2>The benefits of settling a case</h2>
Let us first look at some of the benefits of settling your personal injury case. What many of our past clients have liked about settling is how much more quickly the process comes to an end. Remember that a defendant &#x2013; whether in a civil case or a criminal case &#x2013; rarely <em>wants</em> to be a defendant; most people prefer to avoid a trial, and may offer you a settlement amount for that reason. If you are unhappy with the amount, or if you and your attorney deem it unfair, you can negotiate for a more just number.

Along with less time, settlements often mean fewer expenses. Fewer legal expenses means more money in your pocket when all is said and done &#x2013; and often, that compensation comes more quickly than it would if you win at trial.

Finally, you will know from the beginning just how much compensation you will receive &#x2013; and the amount may remain private, which means you can keep your business your own.
<h2>When a jury trial is the better option</h2>
Sometimes, a trial is the better option for a client. As experienced trial attorneys, we can tell right away when out client has been offered an unfair or unjust settlement &#x2013; and we know how to handle your case if the opposing counsel refuses to see reason. Our experiences as former medical malpractice defense attorneys in Ohio and Kentucky give us an advantage here, because we can view a case from the other side&#x2019;s perspective, and eliminate any issues that might arise in the course of a trial or negotiation before we start.

The truth is, no lawyer worth his or her salt will take a case to a jury that she or she believes is not winnable. Therefore, if your lawyer believes you should go to trial, or agrees to take your case to trial as per your request, then the chances are good your case is strong to start.

A lot of preparation is done for these types of cases. Yes, it can be time consuming and costly, but not for you &#x2013; those expenses are paid by the firm, and you may not be responsible for them unless you win. Furthermore, a trial will be public record. If you are injured by a defective auto product, or because of a drunk driver, etc., the responsible party will be held accountable publicly for his or her actions.

Finally, a trial may lead to a much larger compensatory number than a settlement. In cases where your injury is truly catastrophic, you may obtain both compensatory damages (economic and non-economic) and punitive damages &#x2013; another way to hold a party responsible.

Every case is different, and you should always review the pros and cons of your individual case with your lawyer. If you believe that a trial may be necessary, make sure to work with an experienced Kentucky or Ohio trial attorney who can handle any complications or complexities that come your way.

If you have sustained an injury in a crash or collision as the result of another person&#x2019;s negligence, Crandall &amp; Pera Law wants to help you protect your family and your future. Our experienced auto accident attorneys in Ohio and Kentucky work with you to find the right course of action for your needs. To schedule a free consultation in Kentucky, please call 877.651.7764. For a consultation with an Ohio personal injury attorney, please call 877.686.8879. You can also fill out contact form.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Evaluating Wrongful Death
BASENAME: evaluating-wrongful-death
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 09/27/2016 02:08:40 PM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/f5m8IJSmskU" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

Three very important areas to look at whenever you&#x2019;re evaluating wrongful death would be misdiagnosis of a heart attack, misdiagnosis of cancer, or medication error. Let&#x2019;s talk about misdiagnosis first.

Once of the most important evaluations in misdiagnosis is for a nationally recognized attorney to look at your medical records, as well as your X-rays. In many cases, what is <em>not</em> known is that the physicians could have diagnosed your heart attack or especially your cancer, many months or ever years before it was diagnosed.

Another area of wrongful death to examine is medication errors. There are literally tens of thousands of medication errors that occur throughout the country every year. They would include medication errors that occur when you are in the hospital, as well as when you receive your medication from a pharmacy. Medication errors can cause wrongful death, brain damage and other severe injury. Did medical negligence lead to your loved one&#x2018;s death?

Losing a loved one is always heartbreaking, but finding out that medical negligence played a role in the death of that person can be devastating. Misdiagnosis and medication errors are among the leading causes of wrongful death, but you may also have a claim if your loved one died as a result of:
<ul>
    <li>Surgical mistakes</li>
    <li>Failure to monitor a patient</li>
    <li>Undiagnosed infections</li>
    <li>Defective medical devices or drugs</li>
    <li>Anesthesia errors</li>
    <li>Improper behavior by a doctor</li>
</ul>
In complex medical malpractice cases like these, you want an award-winning law firm on your side to help you seek justice. Crandall &amp; Pera Law was founded by three former medical malpractice defense attorneys in Ohio and Kentucky. Each founding member has the experience and skills to anticipate problems before they arise, and to build a case built on solid evidence and documentation. Because the attorneys know how to dismantle a medical negligence case, they are able to shore up any &#x201C;holes&#x201D; and create a stronger case for their clients.

If you have lost a loved one because of medical negligence, you may have a claim for wrongful death. Let Crandall &amp; Pera Law protect your interests, and help you protect your family. To schedule a free consultation, please fill out this <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact</a> form. You can also call our Kentucky wrongful death attorneys at 877.651.7764, or reach our Ohio team at 877.686.8879.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Cerebral Palsy May be the Result of Medical Negligence
BASENAME: cerebral-palsy-may-result-medical-negligence
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 10/11/2016 12:31:13 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5155" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Cerebral-Palsy-300x200.jpg" alt="Cerebral Palsy May be the Result of Medical Negligence" width="300" height="200">Cerebral palsy, or CP, is not any one disorder: the <a href="http://www.ninds.nih.gov/disorders/cerebral_palsy/cerebral_palsy.htm">National Institutes of Health</a> describes cerebral palsy as &#x201C;a group of neurological disorders that appear in infancy or early childhood and permanently affect body movement, muscle coordination, and balance.&#x201D; In recent years, much research has been done about the causes of CP, finding that about 10% of all cases are the result of medical negligence. Considering that up to 10,000 children in the U.S. are diagnosed with the condition <a href="http://www.cerebralpalsy.org/about-cerebral-palsy/prevalence-and-incidence">every year</a>, a significant number of families are affected by medical errors in serious, potentially devastating, ways.
<h2>CP is a life-long condition</h2>
A child diagnosed with cerebral palsy has that diagnosis for life. There are treatments available to help with the symptoms, but no cure. Thankfully, many people with cerebral palsy go on to live &#x201C;normal&#x201D; lives; they go to school, they go to work, and they start families of their own. Because CP is not a progressive condition, there is no worry that the person&#x2019;s brain function will deteriorate any further. For some victims, however, the condition is so severe that they require assistive technologies to help them, like wheelchairs or respirators, and some will never be able to feed, clothe or bathe themselves, necessitating a lifetime of caregiving services.
<h2>Medical errors that may lead to cerebral palsy</h2>
The type of brain damage that &#x201C;triggers&#x201D; the release of chemicals which can lead to cerebral palsy, as the NIH puts it, can be caused by trauma. When that trauma is the result of the actions (or inaction) of a negligent healthcare provider, you may be able to claim medical negligence as the cause of your child&#x2019;s CP. Some of the medical errors that could lead to the condition include:
<ul>
    <li>Failure to properly monitor the vital signs of the mother and fetus pre-term</li>
    <li>Failure to diagnose and subsequently treat an infection</li>
    <li>Improper use of forceps or a vacuum extractor</li>
    <li>Failure to diagnose an Rh incompatibility</li>
    <li>Failure to diagnose and respond to signs of fetal stress</li>
    <li>Penetrating brain injuries during labor or during a C-section</li>
</ul>
If you are unsure whether or not your child&#x2019;s cerebral palsy was the result of medical negligence, speaking with an experienced birth injury attorney may help you. At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our attorneys review medical documentation with our on-staff Registered Nurses, and document evidence that may prove negligence. We understand that you&#x2019;re fighting for your child&#x2019;s future. Let us help with that fight.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law protects the rights of birth injury victims throughout Ohio and Kentucky. To schedule a free consultation at one of our offices with an experienced OB/GYN negligence lawyer, we invite you to contact us or call us at 877.651.7764 in Kentucky, and 877.686.8879 in Ohio. We know what it takes to build a successful case.

&#xA0;

&#xA0;
-----

TITLE: Meet Steve Crandall

My firm is Crandall &amp; Pera Law &#x2013; and the two things I emphasize about our firm are, first of all, all three lead partners have been defense lawyers in the past, and together we tried hundreds of cases on the defense side. Why is that important? We know how to win a case for the defense; we know how to poke holes in the patient, or plaintiff&#x2019;s, case.

The second thing is that each of us have specialized in medical malpractice for several decades. Each of the three main partners in Crandall &amp; Pera Law have handled medical malpractice cases from both the defense and plaintiff&#x2019;s side. We&#x2019;re national recognized medical malpractice plaintiffs&#x2019; lawyers. We know the medicine almost as good as the physicians that we&#x2019;re going against. We have paralegals who are trained in looking at the medical records, organizing the medical records, and we also have a board of nationally recognized medical experts that we consult with. And because we&#x2019;ve been on both sides of the fence, we put the case together in its best and most successful form to get good results.
<h2>You want an attorney who knows how the other side works</h2>
When you are fighting for your future after an act of medical negligence has hurt you or your loved one, you need an experienced attorney who has a long history of proven results. Steve Crandall began his career as a lawyer defending doctors and hospitals, and therefore knows how these forces think. This experience has allowed Steve Crandall to know how to &#x201C;poke holes&#x201D; in a plaintiff&#x2019;s case. Having training and experience on the defense side first allows the lawyers of Crandall &amp; Pera Law to anticipate any issues that might arise in your case before they happen during trial or settlement negotiations, and to eliminate the holes from the beginning. It also allows the attorneys to prepare clients more effectively and thoroughly for how the defense will structure their arguments against your case.

Having experienced paralegals and Registered Nurses on your side works to your benefit, too. The professional staff at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can answer your questions and explain in detail what your medical records say. They work hand-in-hand with your medical malpractice lawyer to ensure that you understand what is happening at every step of the case, and to collect and document the evidence you need for a strong claim for compensation.

If you or your loved one has been a victim of medical negligence in Ohio or Kentucky, Crandall &amp; Pera Law is ready to help. They are your advocates for a better and brighter future. To learn more about our services, please fill out this <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact</a> form. You can also call our Ohio medical malpractice attorneys at 877.686.8879, or our Kentucky medical negligence lawyers at 877.651.7764.

They had received free tickets for seats behind the first base dugout. A foul ball struck the boy in the head; the high-speed projectile caused severe, traumatic brain injury.

In very small print it said the ticket holder assumed all risk of being injured by thrown bats or thrown balls. <strong>Attorney Pera said that didn&apos;t warn of the risk of sitting right behind the dugout </strong>[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent=&quot;yes&quot; overflow=&quot;visible&quot;][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type=&quot;1_1&quot; background_position=&quot;left top&quot; background_color=&quot;&quot; border_size=&quot;&quot; border_color=&quot;&quot; border_style=&quot;solid&quot; spacing=&quot;yes&quot; background_image=&quot;&quot; background_repeat=&quot;no-repeat&quot; padding=&quot;&quot; margin_top=&quot;0px&quot; margin_bottom=&quot;0px&quot; class=&quot;&quot; id=&quot;&quot; animation_type=&quot;&quot; animation_speed=&quot;0.3&quot; animation_direction=&quot;left&quot; hide_on_mobile=&quot;no&quot; center_content=&quot;no&quot; min_height=&quot;none&quot;][emphasis ours]. The suit included a baseball study. It showed if within a hundred feet of home plate a ball comes at a person 90 miles an hour it is going to hit a person in less than a second.&#x201D;
<h2>We fight for justice</h2>
At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we work hard to protect the innocent and help families get back to normal. The lives of a small boy and his family were altered forever two summers ago at a minor league baseball game, an accident that never should have happened. Now, a young boy has been denied a full life and a young family faces a lifetime of medical care.
