AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Parents Beware: Codeine is an Opioid, Too
BASENAME: parents-beware-codeine-opioid
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 10/18/2016 12:54:04 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5162" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Parents-Beware-Codeine-is-an-Opioid-Too-300x200.jpg" alt="Parents Beware: Codeine is an Opioid, Too" width="300" height="200">On September 19, 2016, the American Academy of Pediatrics issued a warning to parents and doctors about giving the painkiller codeine to children ages 18 and younger. A report titled &#x201C;<a href="http://pediatrics.aappublications.org/content/early/2016/09/15/peds.2016-2396">Codeine: Time to Say &#x2018;No&#x2019;</a>&#x201D; will appear in the October issue of <em>Pediatrics; </em>it shows &#x201C;continued use of the drug in pediatric settings despite growing evidence linking the common painkiller to life-threatening or fatal breathing reactions,&#x201D; according to the AAP.

Doctors prescribe codeine for pain. Any child who has had his or her tonsils, adenoids or wisdom teeth removed is likely to have been given the drug. You can also find it in over-the-counter medicines like cough syrups. More than half the states in the country allow OTC medications with codeine: Kentucky and Ohio are among them.
<h2>Dangers associated with codeine</h2>
Codeine use can also lead to respiratory depression, a rare but potentially fatal condition. A doctor explains it like this in a <a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/codeine-not-safe-children_us_57e195c7e4b0e28b2b50bdec">Huffington Post</a> piece:

&#x201C;Codeine is a &#x2018;prodrug,&#x2019; which means it needs our bodies to become active. When people take a medication with codeine, enzymes in their livers transform codeine into a morphine-derivative to dull down pain&#x2026; But every body is different and, for some, that enzyme can be overactive, creating too much of the morphine-derivative. This, in turn, can slow down breathing and respiratory function and even lead to death&#x2026;. Children are specifically less capable of metabolizing codeine than adults because the enzyme changes as the body matures into adulthood.&#x201D;

In sum, codeine breaks down differently depending on the person. Some people will feel little to no relief, which might prompt an accidental overdose; others might metabolize the drug too quickly, leading to severe respiratory distress. The only way to determine how much of the enzyme is present in your child&#x2019;s body is to have his or her blood tested in a lab.

The elephant in the room, of course, is that codeine can be abused easily. Dextromethorphan, or DXM, is found in many cough syrups. <a href="https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/cough-cold-medicine-abuse">DrugAbuse.gov</a> tells us it &#x201C;may produce euphoria and dissociative effects or even hallucinations when taken in quantities greater than the recommended therapeutic dose.&#x201D; The effects of abuse or an overdose may include:
<ul>
    <li>Nausea</li>
    <li>Impaired motor function</li>
    <li>A feeling of numbness</li>
    <li>Vomiting</li>
    <li>Increased heart rates</li>
    <li>Increased blood pressure</li>
    <li>Fever</li>
    <li>Extreme agitation</li>
    <li>Hypoxic brain damage</li>
    <li>Death</li>
</ul>
There are a number of other pain relievers out on the market that <em>do not</em> have these types of effects, or the potential to lead to addiction. As the AAP points out, parents and doctors have other choices: it is time to exercise them.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law provides comprehensive counsel to victims of medical malpractice in Ohio and Kentucky. If you or your family member has been the victim of a dangerous drug, an act of negligence or a serious accident, we may be able to help. To find out more about our services, or to speak with a medical malpractice attorney, please fill out our contact form, or call our team directly: 877.651.7764 for Kentucky, and 877.686.8879 for Ohio.
-----

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Feds Outline Plan to Regulate Driverless Cars and Prevent Patchwork Legislation
BASENAME: feds-outline-plan-regulate-driverless-cars-prevent-patchwork-legislation
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 10/27/2016 02:42:19 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5193" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Feds-Outline-Plan-to-Regulate-Driverless-Cars-and-Prevent-Patchwork-Legislation-300x300.jpg" alt="Feds Outline Plan to Regulate Driverless Cars and Prevent Patchwork Legislation" width="300" height="300">On Monday, September 19, Transportation Secretary Anthony Foxx finally rolled out a policy paper that is intended to address the regulation of driverless vehicles. At the moment, states are responsible for regulating drivers, while the federal government regulates automakers, requiring safety features and handling defective vehicles. The question everywhere is whether the onboard software that operates driverless vehicles qualifies as a safety feature or as a driver.
<h2>Preventing future problems</h2>
The policy paper from the Transportation Secretary is intended to prevent patchwork legislation from creating massive obstacles to the emerging technology. Test vehicles in different states have already spurred local rules in California, Nevada, Florida, Michigan and Pennsylvania with more on the way. Raj Rajkumar, a Carnegie Mellon University professor who is at the forefront of driverless car innovations, told <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/trafficandcommuting/federal-officials-plan-aggressive-approach-to-driverless-cars/2016/09/19/3e78411e-7e92-11e6-8d0c-fb6c00c90481_story.html"><em>The Washington Post</em></a>, &#x201C;This could be a nightmare, if you drive across a state border in an autonomous vehicle.&#x201D;

Creating legislation to deal with driverless cars is no easy task. <em>The Washington Post</em> reported, &#x201C;The Department of Transportation opted to describe the document as &#x2018;guidance&#x2019; for the industry and state officials, both out of caution and for a practical reason... Federal officials worried the premature regulation of that technology might inhibit its development. They also realized the ponderous process to produce an official federal rule &#x2014; it&#x2019;s not uncommon for it to take five years &#x2014; could leave them with something already outdated before it saw the light of day.&#x201D;
<h2>The heart of the machine</h2>
In addition to the timing, solving the question of liability in an accident is no small feat. At the heart of the dilemma is the impossible question; if a lethal collision between two parties is unavoidable, which party should the computer choose to protect? When a family member dies because an automated vehicle made a decision, who can be held responsible? Is road safety ultimately going to wind up in the hands of software engineers, or will they hide behind the code that ultimately makes the decision? These are the types of questions that will face our legislators in the coming years, and they will not be easy to answer.

While advancing technology ultimately makes our world safer, developing those technologies carries an inherent risk. Before GPS navigation improved, drivers found themselves turning off bridges or driving into lakes. Smartphones, despite their capabilities, interrupt drivers on a regular basis, causing minor and major accidents alike. Onboard information centers in vehicles are more distracting than they are helpful. Each of these technologies is wonderful when it works properly, but potentially deadly during development.

At the moment, distracted driving is our biggest challenge. In 2013, the most recent year for which data is available, 10% of all fatal crashes and 18% of all injury crashes were caused by distracted driving, according to the <a href="http://www.distraction.gov/downloads/pdfs/Distracted_Driving_2013_Research_note.pdf">National Highway Traffic Safety Administration</a>.

If a distracted driver injured you or your loved one, you may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky auto accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call 877.686.8879 for our Ohio team, 877.651.7764 for our Kentucky accident attorneys, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.
-----

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Congratulations, Marc Pera, on Being Named to the AIOPIA&#x2019;s 10 Best Attorneys List for the Second Year!
BASENAME: congratulations-marc-pera-named-aiopias-10-best-attorneys-list-second-year
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 10/25/2016 12:55:41 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5190" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Screen-Shot-2016-10-25-at-10.53.51-AM-300x139.png" alt="Congratulations, Marc Pera, on Being Named to the AIOPIA&#x2019;s 10 Best Attorneys List for the Second Year!" width="300" height="139">All of us at Crandall &amp; Pera Law would like to congratulate our own Marc Pera on being named, for the second year in a row, to the &#x201C;10 Best for Client Satisfaction&#x201D; list of Ohio personal injury attorneys by the <a href="http://aiopia.org/">American Institute of Personal Injury Attorneys</a>. The AIOPIA is part of the American Institute of Legal Counsel, an objective ratings service which believes &#x201C;that Attorneys should be recognized for excellence in their field and that potential Clients can benefit from this knowledge.&#x201D;

In order to be selected for this honor, applicants &#x2013; who can only be nominated by another attorney, a client or the Institute itself &#x2013; must demonstrate not only their successes in courtrooms or boardrooms, but also that those successes are beneficial to their clients above all other things. There are specific criteria that the AIOLC reviews when considering an applicant. The attorney must:
<ul>
    <li>Have a 10/10 client satisfaction rating</li>
    <li>Be considered a &#x201C;top rated&#x201D; attorney by other ratings systems</li>
    <li>Be an industry leader</li>
    <li>Have no unresolved complaints against him or her</li>
</ul>
The AIOLC also looks at applicants&#x2019; awards and accolades, speaking engagements and publications, which associations they belong to, and their continuing levels of education.

Over the past couple of years, the group has grown enough to offer 10 Best Client Satisfaction awards for attorneys across the country, and practicing in 14 different areas of the law.

This is Marc&#x2019;s second consecutive year being selected for membership for the group for Western Ohio, and we could not be prouder of him if we tried. Marc is not only a skilled and aggressive attorney, but he is also a genuinely empathetic man, who cares deeply about his clients and their families. So it is really no surprise that Marc would win yet another award for his dedication and service to his clients &#x2013; from the AIOPIA or from any group. He works hard on behalf of his clients, and he is willing and able to keep fighting for them until he knows that justice has been served.

Congratulations again, Marc, on your second year membership to the American Institute of Personal Injury Attorneys &#x2013; you deserve it!

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Birth Trauma
BASENAME: birth-trauma
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 10/20/2016 03:05:43 PM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FPOoS3MPiMg" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

What&#x2019;s unique about birth trauma is an evaluation of two kinds of cases; one is brachial plexus, and one is brain damage. Brachial plexus cases refer to injuries that occur to the nerves of the child as it is being delivered. Generally speaking, the physician who delivers the child places too much traction on the baby&#x2019;s head as it&#x2019;s being delivered, and it damages the nerves that control the baby&#x2019;s arms.

Brain damage is slightly different. We look at the prenatal records, and we see how the course of your labor went. Typically what happens is that there are warning signs during the delivery that the physician does not see or appreciate. Instead of doing a Cesarean section and delivering the child early, they allow the labor to progress and unfortunately that leads to lack of oxygen. When the baby is delivered, we find out the baby has suffered brain damage.

If someone is trying to evaluate a birth injury case, it is very important to first of all go to a lawyer who specializes in birth trauma and birth injury. It has to be a lawyer who is able to look at the prenatal records, but the most important aspect is for the lawyer to consult with an expert witness to look at what are called electronic fetal monitoring strips. Those are the strips that are on the side of the bed that show the baby&#x2019;s heart rate, and show the contraction pattern. An expert can see warning signs that if a physician does not look at or see can result in birth injury.

In addition to brachial plexus and brain damage, there&#x2019;s another area of birth trauma that should be evaluated, and that is fractured skulls or direct trauma to the brain. How that occurs is during the labor period, if a woman has the natural forces of labor and the baby is getting hung up and cannot be delivered, the forces of labor can actually pound the skull of the baby and cause brain damage or fractures of the skull. Again, a nationally renowned birth trauma attorney can look at the prenatal records, the delivery records, as well as the fetal monitoring strips to see if a type of damage like that has occurred.

Birth trauma can have a variety of causes, but the most significant effects are on you and your family. When your doctor fails to properly oversee your pregnancy, labor and delivery, your family can be affected forever. Sometimes, the symptoms of birth trauma are apparent immediately. Alternatively, it may take many months for an injury to come to light; in both cases, there is no substitute for the experienced Kentucky and Ohio birth trauma attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law.
<h2>Birth trauma by the numbers</h2>
Injuries during labor, delivery and infancy are far more common than we like to think. We wrote about the numbers last December, but they bear repeating. The most recent data available was from 2006; it showed:
<ul>
    <li>Nearly 157,700 avoidable injuries to mothers and newborns occurred during childbirth that year.</li>
    <li>Newborns covered by Medicaid had worse (higher) rates of injury than newborns covered by private insurance, though wealth did not appear to play a role in the difference in rates.</li>
    <li>Vaginal births with instruments accounted for the highest injury rates.</li>
</ul>
Healthcare professionals train for years to learn how to handle complications during labor and delivery. When trained and trusted professionals make mistakes, the consequences can last a lifetime. If your child has suffered complications from a birth trauma or birth injury, your family may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio birth trauma attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Contact our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/01/2016 12:43:53 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-full wp-image-2080" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/CPW-LOGO.jpg" alt="Crandall &amp; Pera Law Has Been Named to the 2017 List of &#x201C;Best Law Firms&#x201D; by U.S. News and Best Lawyers&#xAE;!" width="250" height="250">Crandall &amp; Pera Law is proud to announce that we have been named to the 2017 edition of &#x201C;Best Law Firms,&#x201D; with a Tier One ranking for our work on behalf of victims of medical malpractice. Crandall &amp; Pera Law is extremely proud of our selection as a Tier One firm, the top ranking provided by <em>U.S. News-Best Lawyers</em>.

In order to be eligible for selection, at least one attorney from the firm must be named to the annual <em>Best Lawyers</em>&#xAE; list in the given practice area. Then, <a href="http://bestlawfirms.usnews.com/methodology.aspx"><em>U.S. News &#x2013; Best Lawyers</em> asks</a> clients &#x201C;to provide feedback on firm practice groups, addressing expertise, responsiveness, understanding of a business and its needs, cost-effectiveness, civility, and whether they would refer another client to the firm.&#x201D; They also ask other attorneys to vote on the nominated firm&#x2019;s &#x201C;expertise, responsiveness, integrity, cost-effectiveness, whether they would refer a matter to a firm, and whether they consider a firm a worthy competitor.&#x201D;

This information, combined with feedback form the attorneys, as well as data regarding the &#x201C;landscape surrounding the nationally ranked practice area,&#x201D; is what helped to create the overall score for the firm. The tiers are then based off what percentage of firms got within the highest scoring firms overall. In other words, law firms like Crandall &amp; Pera Law, with some of the highest scores, were then given Tier One status.
<h2>Why it matters to medical malpractice victims</h2>
The &#x201C;Best Law Firms&#x201D; list is one of the most comprehensive records of skilled law firms in the world, by one of the oldest and most respective objective ranking companies. They pour through millions of applications each year before finally selecting less than 1% of all applicants for inclusion. Whether you have sustained an injury because of an act of medical negligence, need a personal injury attorney after a serious auto accident, or need a lawyer for any part of your life, <em>U.S. News &#x2013; Best Lawyers</em> offers detailed insight into finding the right firm for your needs.

We hope you will join us in congratulating Steve Crandall and Marc Pera, along with our associates and our staff, for this latest honor. We promise to continue to fight on behalf of our clients in Ohio and Kentucky, and to help them protect their families and their futures.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Tractor Trailer Wreck That Shutdown Route 35 for More Than 24 Hours Scared Hazmat Crews
BASENAME: feds-outline-plan-to-regulate-driverless-cars-and-prevent-patchwork-legislation
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/08/2016 02:17:53 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5222" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/Tractor-Trailer-Wreck-That-Shutdown-Route-35-for-More-Than-24-Hours-Scared-Hazmat-Crews-300x200.jpg" alt="Tractor Trailer Wreck That Shutdown Route 35 for More Than 24 Hours Scared Hazmat Crews" width="300" height="200">The Ohio State Highway Patrol responded to what was believed to be a routine crash on September 19. A commercial truck driven by 28-year-old Devin Harris of Illinois had left the roadway and rolled down an embankment. Harris was trapped in the cab, and was transported by medical helicopter to Grant Medical Center in Columbus after being extracted by the Coalton Fire Department.
<h2>Hazardous cargo causes mandatory shutdown</h2>
While the fire department worked to extricate Harris, concern was growing among first responders; the heavily damaged tanker was full of a volatile chemical called vinylpyridine. While no leaks were apparent, residents within a half-mile of the accident were advised of the incident, and the Ohio Department of Transportation shutdown Route 35 in both directions. The shutdown remained in effect for more than a day until a recovery team that could handle the chemical was located.

The Telegram reported:

&#x201C;Jackson County Emergency Management Agency Director Robert Czechlewski&#x2026; considered this the most potentially dangerous situation the local HazMat team has dealt with in the last 28 years. He said the tank holding the estimated 35,000 gallons of the chemical did not rupture, but was heavily damaged.&#xA0; &#x2018;This is a highly corrosive and flammable chemical,&#x2019; Czechlewski reported from then scene where he and many others were up all night. &#x2018;This chemical is so dangerous that a lot of the contracting companies don&apos;t want to touch it. The chemical is in a container, which was smashed, but didn&apos;t rupture. It will have to be pumped from the tank and hauled away.&#x2019;&#x201D;
<h2>Big trucks hauling hazardous materials are a danger to everyone</h2>
Thankfully, the tank did not rupture, the driver survived, and the wreck was cleared. However, the danger that the accident posed is undeniable; vinylpyridine is corrosive to the human respiratory tract. Had the unthinkable happened, dozens of first responders and nearby residents could have been killed. Big trucks and their dangerous cargo are an undeniable hazard on our roads.

If you or your loved one has been injured after a commercial truck collision or exposure to hazardous cargo, you may be entitled to compensation for your injuries and lost wages. The experienced Ohio truck accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764 or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Medication May Be the Biggest Danger to Your Sick Child
BASENAME: medication-may-be-the-biggest-danger-to-your-sick-child
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/04/2016 02:06:20 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5216" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/Medication-May-Be-the-Biggest-Danger-to-Your-Sick-Child-300x223.jpg" alt="Medication May Be the Biggest Danger to Your Sick Child" width="300" height="223">With all types of medical errors killing more people than ever, it should come as no surprise that medication errors are on the rise as well. However, children face a disproportionate risk of medication error when compared to the rest of the population, primarily because even minor dosing errors can have major effects on their small bodies. The true scope of the problem is difficult to measure, not only because &#x201C;error&#x201D; can mean different things, but also because a mistake can happen at any point from prescription to ingestion and involve multiple people.

Small mistakes mean big problems

<a href="http://www.wsj.com/articles/sick-children-face-potentially-deadly-danger-medication-errors-1474855500">The Wall Street Journal</a> reported, &#x201C;Part of the problem, health professionals say, is that dosing is often based on a child&#x2019;s weight, which can lead to calculation errors. Some liquid medications only come in concentrations suitable for adults, so the pharmacist may have to dilute it for a child. And a parent measuring a dose may use a spoon or something else on hand, instead of a specialized tool to pull the correct amount.&#x201D;

Compounding the difficulties in calculating and administering medication is the continuing growth and chemical changes that children undergo. Dosages must be recalculated almost constantly, especially for more dangerous compounds. In worst-case scenarios, children can die from an unintentional overdose. In others, like we wrote recently, they may simply wind up with a chemical dependency from something as mundane as Tylenol with codeine, an opioid-based drug.

Healthcare providers are working on solutions that range from allowing physicians to send medication orders directly to IV infusion pumps to alarms that alert nurses and doctors when a setting is outside the normal range for a particular patient. However, when it comes to medicating children, small and common math errors pose big problems for these young patients.
<h2>The scope of the problem</h2>
The following information from <a href="http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/819776-overview#a6">Medscape</a> illustrates just how disproportionately medication errors affect children. Pediatricians are prescribing a drug called Clonidine that is extremely effective in treating certain neurological problems. In 2014, there were 5063 total reports of toxic exposures to Clonidine. Of these, almost 75% occurred in children under 19, and almost half of those exposures occurred in children under 6.

Dangerous drugs can hurt more than they help, especially when your child&#x2019;s doctor or pediatrician is negligent. If your child has been injured or fallen ill after a medication mistake, you may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky medical negligence attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764 or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Types of Birth Injury
BASENAME: types-birth-injury
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/11/2016 12:13:39 AM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cIAWEHiiwws" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

Birth injury encompasses a lot of injuries that occur to a child. Most people think birth injury simply means brain damage, and it certainly does. When a child is born and they start to miss developmental milestones, they can&apos;t talk in the timeframe that they should, the child can&apos;t walk or feed themselves, then people begin to investigate what occurred to the child.

Many times what we find is that a lack of oxygen during birth is what led to that brain damage. But birth injury also encompasses and includes what&apos;s called shoulder dystocia. That simply means that a child is being born, and that child is larger or heavier than would fit through their mother&apos;s birth canal. And what occurs in that instance is, nerve damage in and around their neck and shoulder area leads to what&apos;s called brachial plexus injury. What we found is that occurs not simply because the baby was larger than the doctor anticipated, but because the obstetrician actually places too much traction on the babies head when it&apos;s being delivered, and that&apos;s negligence.&#xA0;We can determine that from reviewing the records.

The second injury is brain damage, and that can occur two ways. If physician does not deliver a child timely, they have a lack of oxygen to their brain and that leads to brain damage. And secondly, brain damage can occur if a physician gives too much medication to the mom while laboring, causing contractions that are too close together. That trauma can actually also cause brain damage, so it&#x2019;s very important to look at the records, determine the type of injuries that can occur and whether or not it was the result of medical negligence.
<h2>The many types of birth injury</h2>
Childbirth is a complex process, and injuries or trauma that occur before, during or after childbirth can have lifelong consequences. Pregnancy involves a large number of medical professionals who must act as a team to relay relevant information at all stages. When one link in the information chain is broken, the consequences can affect your child and your family forever.

There are a number of complications that can arise during labor and delivery, all of which require a medical team to respond quickly and appropriately. Complications and trauma can occur at every stage of pregnancy, labor, delivery and infancy. The most common types of birth injuries at different stages can include:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Prenatal negligence.</strong> When screening or testing for certain medical conditions is conducted improperly or not at all, both mother and child are exposed to unnecessary health risks.</li>
    <li><strong>Labor and delivery negligence.</strong> When healthcare professionals fail to monitor vital signs or notice a problem, labor can be delayed and the vital supply of oxygen to the infant can be cut off, resulting in permanent brain damage.</li>
    <li><strong>Negligent use of medical devices or drugs during delivery</strong>. When tools like forceps, vacuum extractors or drugs are used or administered improperly, permanent damage can occur.</li>
    <li><strong>Postpartum negligence.</strong> When healthcare professionals fail to adequately monitor a newborn, life-threatening health issues can cause long-term disability or even death.</li>
</ul>
If your child was injured through negligence at any stage of your pregnancy, labor, delivery or post-partum care, you may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Ohio birth injury attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Medical Records Evaluation
BASENAME: medical-records-evaluation
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/17/2016 11:58:34 AM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bLVozj1CjwU" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

Whenever clients come for an evaluation of medical malpractice, one of the most important things that they may not be aware of is that their care provider can be altering their written chart as well as their computer chart while they are still in the hospital. So one of the things that needs to happen, is that your records are evaluated both internally as well as forensic document and computer experts. Through those evaluations, oftentimes we find that your care providers were not only negligent, but they were altering your records to try to hide it....

Almost any type of care you receive generates tremendous amounts of paperwork, often written in dense medical jargon and accompanied by codes for billing, referrals and prescriptions. The more complicated the treatment, the more paperwork it generates; deciphering the paper trail can seem utterly impossible, especially with the physical and emotional toll of hospitalization or other care.

When you or your loved one require medical care, just understanding the options and preparing for treatment can be daunting. Realizing when mistakes are made can be difficult, especially because medical mistakes have a high psychological and emotional toll on victims and their families. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio medical malpractice lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law have built a team uniquely suited to review and evaluate medical records for fraud.

When it comes to your health, your medical records are just as important as the medications you take and the treatment you receive. The documents that make up your record provide a log of the steps taken by your healthcare providers and an overall snapshot of important details about you. When those records are compromised, your life is on the line.

If you believe that your or your loved one was injured because a healthcare professional lied, you may be entitled to compensation for injuries, lost wages and other damages. For a free evaluation with an attorney from Crandall &amp; Pera Law, please call 877.686.8879 to reach our experienced Ohio team, 877.651.7764 for our legal team in Kentucky, or fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact </a>form.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Fiery 18-Wheeler Crash Latest Casualty of I-80 Construction
BASENAME: fiery-18-wheeler-crash-latest-casualty-80-construction
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/15/2016 01:33:59 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5231" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/Fiery-18-Wheeler-Crash-Latest-Casualty-of-I-80-Construction-300x200.jpg" alt="Fiery 18-Wheeler Crash Latest Casualty of I-80 Construction" width="300" height="200">An early morning crash in late September happened when the driver of a tractor-trailer drove off the road and was unable to regain the pavement from the soft shoulder. Randy Walters was on his way to work when he saw the big rig leave the road, roll over and catch fire. He stopped and helped the driver, Mark Cosgrove, out of the cab. Cosgrove told Walters he was hauling over 8,000 gallons of gasoline; both men ran as far as possible.

Hazardous cargo creates hazardous conditions

The overturned tractor-trailer was leaking liquid gasoline, and the fire had just begun as the men got away unscathed. While no one was injured, first responders had a significant problem on their hands; namely, a small fire that was about to become a big one. Fire crews were several miles west of the crash, and could not get through the combined traffic created by the accident and ongoing road construction. The fire was in a bad place.

WKBN 27 reported:

&#x201C;Ohio State Highway Patrol troopers, local police and the Ohio Department of Transportation quickly shut down the interstate as well as highways leading into the area, allowing firefighters from nearly a dozen departments to get to the scene, carrying water and chemical foam to dowse the flames. But just when crews thought they had things under control, the fire re-started. &#x2019;When the guys were spraying down the frame of the truck, it made the foam go away and exposed it again and reignited,&#x2019; said Chief Birch. By 10:30 a.m., the fire was finally out, but it burned two trucks and a car left behind.&#x201D;

The accident happened around 6 a.m.; it took nearly four and a half hours for the fire to burn off nearly all of the gasoline the truck had been carrying. Hazmat crews were called to erect dams to prevent the dangerous chemical foam from running off into storm drains and ditches. The fire burned so long and hotly that the asphalt will have to be removed and replaced before the road is safe to use again.

I-80 construction and big rigs are a recipe for disaster

Highway Patrol spokesman Lt. Brian Holt said that construction in the area increased the number of crashes the department has seen; a second tractor-trailer rolled off the highway that same day, less than ten miles away. Construction zones are creating dangerous conditions for drivers that are rife with distractions. Throw in big rigs carrying hazardous cargo, and taking a ride on I-80 can mean taking your life in your hands.

Big trucks cause big accidents, and big accidents cause serious injuries. If you or your loved one has been injured in a commercial truck accident, you may be entitled

to compensation for your injuries and lost wages. The experienced Ohio commercial truck accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call 877.686.8879 or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: When People Say &#x201C;The Holidays Are Killing Me,&#x201D; They Might Be Right
BASENAME: people-say-holidays-killing-might-right
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/22/2016 01:28:37 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5241" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/ThinkstockPhotos-612645812-300x200.jpg" alt="When People Say &#x201C;The Holidays Are Killing Me,&#x201D; They Might Be Right" width="300" height="200">The holidays bring families together from across the country. Warm fires, turkeys shellacked to a high gloss, mountains of mashed potatoes and dozens of sides conjure feelings of coziness and warmth and satisfaction of being overstuffed in an overstuffed chair. Unfortunately, all that comfort and bliss comes at a high cost.

The US <a href="http://onsafety.cpsc.gov/blog/2015/12/07/tis-the-season-to-decorate-safely/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Consumer Product Safety Commission</a> reported 12 fatalities and an estimated 14,500 emergency rooms visits in November and December of 2014, and those numbers are only the result of holiday <em>decorations</em>. The holidays don&#x2019;t just host family gatherings; they also hold a host large and small risks that threaten your family during the holiday season, like these excerpted from <a href="http://health.alot.com/wellness/10-ways-that-thanksgiving-dinner-can-kill-you--9975/?s=8" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Health.com</a>:
<ul>
    <li>That generous spread looks appetizing, but it&#x2019;s full of tricky bones and giblets floating ominously in the gravy boat. Choking can be deadly, but serious injuries can affect those who survive, including a lacerated trachea or perforated bowel.</li>
    <li><strong>Food allergy/food poisoning<em>.</em></strong> Allergies can develop at any time in your life, which means that Aunt Mary&#x2019;s famous pecan pie that you&#x2019;ve enjoyed every year since you can remember might prove to be your undoing. Knowing your allergies and asking about ingredients might save your life, so make sure to keep a list on your person (in case of a reaction), and carry an Epi-pen if you have a prescription for one.</li>
    <li><strong>Heart attack<em>.</em></strong> Eating high-calorie, high-fat, and high-sodium foods in excess can leave you dangerously dehydrated. That thicker blood, coupled with the blood pressure spike from listening to 8-year-old Tommy&#x2019;s 45-minute drum solo, can put you in the emergency room if you&#x2019;re not careful. Drink some extra water, avoid alcohol, and try to eat in moderation when you can.</li>
    <li><strong>Burns/Smoke Inhalation<em>.</em></strong> Between the miles of electrical cabling, the 400-degree oven, the tea light centerpiece, the overloaded circuits and the roaring fireplace, fire is a very real risk. Inhaling smoke or toxic fumes from burning plastic or insulation can end a meal with a trip to the emergency room for the whole family. A misplaced dish towel can lead to a kitchen fire within minutes. Make sure all small children are safely in the other room when you&#x2019;re cooking, and supervised at all times.</li>
    <li><strong>Auto accidents<em>.</em></strong> Last, but not least, everyone is rushing around to pick up those final ingredients or make it home for dinner in time. Maybe you realized last minute that you forgot the cranberry sauce, or that you misread the invitation. No matter what the reason, stay calm, keep to the speed limit, and be patient &#x2013; everyone else wants to get home, too.</li>
    <li><strong>Drunk drivers.</strong> We cannot stress this enough: do not drink and drive. Do not let your loved ones drink and drive. If you can avoid driving at all, do so, because you cannot stop others from doing the wrong thing. Drunk drivers are a menace on the road, contributing to needless deaths, catastrophic injuries and untold amounts of property damage. Please be safe and be smart.</li>
</ul>
At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we hope you won&#x2019;t need our services this holiday season, but we want you to know that we&#x2019;re here for you when you need us. From our family to yours, have a safe and happy Thanksgiving, and remember that our experienced Kentucky and Ohio personal injury lawyers will fight for you and yours when the unthinkable happens.

For a free consultation, call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, or contact us today.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: College Football Players Diagnosed with CTE Confirms Warnings from Concussion Legacy Foundation
BASENAME: college-football-players-diagnosed-cte-confirms-warnings-concussion-legacy-foundation
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/29/2016 11:16:52 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5249" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/College-Football-Players-Diagnosed-with-CTE-Confirms-Warnings-from-Concussion-Legacy-Foundation-300x213.jpg" alt="College Football Players Diagnosed with CTE Confirms Warnings from Concussion Legacy Foundation" width="300" height="213">The Concussion Legacy Foundation recently announced the results of a study from the VA-BU-CLF Brain Bank that found that former players from more than 100 college football programs were diagnosed with Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy, or CTE. The results confirm the message that the CLF has been promoting for years; that all football players, at all levels, are at risk of the developing the neuro-degenerative disease.

Chris Nowinski, co-founder and CEO of the CLF, told <a href="http://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/ncaaf/2016/10/19/college-football-programs-and-concussions/92415908/">USA Today</a>, &#x201C;This information is being released to raise awareness that CTE is not just an issue for professional football players. The data should not be interpreted to say that players from these schools are at greater risk than other college players. Instead, the data shows the widespread reach of this disease, and the commitment by the alumni and their families of these schools to support CTE research by participating in brain donation.&#x201D;
<h2>Knowing the signs of a concussion can help your loved ones</h2>
Unfortunately, there is no test for CTE; the only way to confirm diagnosis is by brain dissection after death. However, knowing the signs and symptoms of concussion can potentially save players and their families from the effects of CTE. The disease is more likely to develop in those who suffer repeated head trauma, and is exacerbated by not allowing that trauma to fully heal before another injury occurs. Knowing these signs and symptoms can keep players on the sidelines until it&#x2019;s safe to be on the field again:
<ul>
    <li>Headache or neck pain</li>
    <li>Nausea, tinnitus, dizziness, or tiredness</li>
    <li>Feeling dazed or not your normal self</li>
    <li>Trouble walking or sleeping</li>
    <li>Weakness, numbness or decreased coordination</li>
    <li>Repeated vomiting or nausea</li>
    <li>Confusion</li>
    <li>Slurred Speech</li>
    <li>Seizure</li>
</ul>
If someone you know is experiencing these symptoms and the symptoms are not going away, seek immediate medical treatment. Everyone should seek medical clearance to return to normal activities after a head trauma. Even mild traumatic brain injury can have devastating and permanent effects; it&#x2019;s not worth taking a chance.

When your loved one suffers a traumatic brain injury, your life can change forever in an instant. At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our team has the experience to get you the compensation you need for medical bills and continuing care. Call 877.686.8879 to talk to our experienced Ohio traumatic brain injury lawyers, 877.651.7764 to reach our injury attorneys in Kentucky, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

&#xA0;

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Evaluating Surgical Errors
BASENAME: evaluating-surgical-errors
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 11/25/2016 03:03:34 PM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/9RDwEg3fEnM" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

Surgical errors in the evaluation of medical negligence is important, but here&#x2019;s the most important thing: individuals comes after they&#x2019;ve had a bad surgery. There&#x2019;s a bad result. That doesn&#x2019;t necessarily mean there&#x2019;s medical negligence. You have to get the medical records, and look at the anesthesia records, and especially the surgical records: the operative report. That will tell you whether or not you had simply a bad outcome &#x2013; which does occur &#x2013; or whether the surgeon or the anesthesiologist in the case, were negligent, leading to that bad result. But until you look at the medical records, you&#x2019;re not sure if it&#x2019;s bad results or negligence, which is often the case.

Surgeons make mistakes more often than you might think. If the error is caught quickly, fixed immediately, and leads to no lasting effects, you may not be able to make a claim for compensation. That is because a successful medical malpractice claim must prove:
<ol>
    <li>The doctor owed a duty of care to the patient.</li>
    <li>The doctor behaved negligently, or failed to live up to that duty of care.</li>
    <li>The failure or breach of duty was responsible for the injuries sustained by the patient.</li>
    <li>The injuries led to certain kinds of damage, such as loss of income, medical bills or pain and suffering.</li>
</ol>
If these criteria are met, then you can make a claim against the surgeon or anesthesiologist &#x2013; or any medical professional &#x2013; whose negligence led to your injuries.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we help victims of medical malpractice in Kentucky and Ohio whose lives have been changed &#x2013; often permanently. Our team includes multiple Registered Nurses, who work hand-in-hand with the attorneys of our firm to review medical records, answer our clients&#x2019; questions, and document evidence of surgical errors.

If you were hurt by a surgeon at a Kentucky or Ohio hospital or clinic, Crandall &amp; Pera Law may be able to help. We invite you to call our Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys at 877.651.4464, our Ohio team at 877.686.8879, or to use our contact form.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Digital Diversion Caused the Biggest Spike in Highway Fatalities in Half a Century
BASENAME: digital-diversion-caused-biggest-spike-highway-fatalities-half-century
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 12/13/2016 02:38:15 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5260" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Digital-Diversion-Caused-the-Biggest-Spike-in-Highway-Fatalities-in-Half-a-Century-300x195.jpg" alt="Digital Diversion Caused the Biggest Spike in Highway Fatalities in Half a Century" width="300" height="195">Automakers and government regulations have been making cars smarter and safer than ever for more than four decades. Emerging technologies and stricter approval requirements first added crumple zones and airbags and later introduced seatbelt warning sensors; now, cars that drive and stop themselves are poised to become a reality in the next few years. With all those safety improvements, highway fatalities have been in steady decline for more than forty years, but not anymore.
<h2>The tide is turning</h2>
<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/16/business/tech-distractions-blamed-for-rise-in-traffic-fatalities.html?_r=0">The New York Times</a> reported recently that &#x201C;highway fatalities last year recorded the largest annual percentage increase in 50 years. And the numbers so far this year are even worse. In the first six months of 2016, highway deaths jumped 10.4 percent, to 17,775, from the comparable period of 2015.&#x201D;

The culprit? More distraction than ever. Smartphones that contain an ever-expanding library of available apps are being linked into vehicle systems like Ford Motor&#x2019;s Sync, Apple&#x2019;s CarPlay and Google&#x2019;s Android Auto. These systems purport to make driving safer by making smartphone interaction hands-free, but these selfsame systems may be increasing our level of distraction instead of decreasing it.
<h2>More new tech may hurt instead of help</h2>
When was the last time you used a voice command on a phone or tablet that you didn&#x2019;t have to repeat or clarify? Bluetooth connections can take forever, and interacting with your car&#x2019;s voice command system takes your eyes off the road far more often than it works flawlessly. Lawmakers are additionally concerned that emerging technologies like Tesla&#x2019;s Autopilot may create a false sense of security in already distracted drivers.

At the moment, distracted driving is a secondary offense for adults, which means that law enforcement must cite an initial cause for a traffic stop. What this means for your family is that the law cannot protect you from distracted drivers. However, there are options when a distracted driver injures you or your loved one. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio auto accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call 877.686.8879 for Ohio, 877.651.7764 for Kentucky, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us </a>today for a free consultation.

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Sepsis &amp; SIRS
BASENAME: sepsis-sirs
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 12/16/2016 07:13:43 AM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/orljTiTwQyo?rel=0&amp;controls=0&amp;showinfo=0" width="100%" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"><span data-mce-type="bookmark" style="display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;" class="mce_SELRES_start"></span></iframe>

Sepsis, oftentimes we see it as a missed diagnosis following an abdominal surgery. Any time someone operates on your bowel, which is full of all kinds of nasty bugs, one of the risks is that you get an infection, and then you become septic. So anytime you have abdominal surgery, a physician following you after that surgery needs to be acutely aware of the signs and symptoms of sepsis because you were already at risk. They just cut on your bowel, and if that place they sewed back together doesn&#x2019;t hold, bacteria get out.

If you&#x2019;ve had diverticulitis, which is just pockets of your bowel that become infected and inflamed, and those little pockets that stand out from your bowel and if they rupture, they just release bowel contents into your body, feces. And guess what? Your body reacts, and you develop SIRS, and they&#x2019;ve got to get in there and they&#x2019;ve got to fix it. Even if they fix that, guess what, for the next week they should be watching you carefully to make sure that you don&#x2019;t become septic again.

Postoperatively is one of the big times that you will see patients develop sepsis, but you could be working out, you know, out on a farm or whatever, have a really bad cut, ignore it. For whatever reason that bacteria gets into your bloodstream and you develop SIRS and suddenly you&#x2019;re sitting at home and you&#x2019;re panting, and you&#x2019;ve got a bad fever and your heart&#x2019;s racing, well you need to get into a doctor. You show that doctor that festering cut, and they look at you and go well the heart rate&#x2019;s above 90, the respiratory rate&#x2019;s above 20, he&#x2019;s got a fever of 102, he&#x2019;s got a festering cut right there, it should be a pretty easy diagnosis. Unfortunately though, sometimes medical care providers miss it.

When your body responds to an infection, the response can have serious consequences. The <a href="http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/sepsis/home/ovc-20169784">Mayo Clinic</a> says, &#x201C;Sepsis is a potentially life-threatening complication of an infection. Sepsis occurs when chemicals released into the bloodstream to fight the infection trigger inflammatory responses throughout the body. This inflammation can trigger a cascade of changes that can damage multiple organ systems, causing them to fail.&#x201D;
<h2>SIRS &amp; Sepsis</h2>
Any wound can become septic without proper treatment, but sepsis is far more likely to be the result of a bowel perforation from a foreign object or surgery. This is simply because the thin layer of tissue in the bowel is all that separates your body from the outside world of food &amp; waste. When that layer is torn even slightly, infection happens rapidly and attacks vulnerable internal organs quickly.

Systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) is one of the first symptoms of sepsis. It is a sign that your body is fighting an infection, but SIRS can cause a host of problems that seem unrelated to the infection and compromise the normal function of other organs and organ systems.

The criteria for diagnosing sepsis is fairly straightforward; an infection must be known or suspected, and a patient must have two of these three symptoms:
<ul>
    <li>Body temperature above 101&#xB0;F or below 96.8&#xB0;F</li>
    <li>Heart rate above 90 beats per minute</li>
    <li>Respiratory rate higher than 20 breaths per minute</li>
</ul>
The longer sepsis goes untreated, the more devastating the consequences. Risk of sepsis is higher after a cut or surgery, especially abdominal surgery. Sepsis may be among the worst of all missed diagnoses because it progresses so rapidly and should be an obvious consideration in postoperative diagnoses.

If your loved one suffered complications from sepsis or SIRS after any surgery, you may be the victim of medical malpractice. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you need for medical bills, lost wages and other damages. Call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, or contact us today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Marc Pera
TITLE: Tort Reform in Ohio: Good for Rapists, Bad for Victims
BASENAME: tort-reform-ohio-good-rapists-bad-victims
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 12/21/2016 11:46:12 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright wp-image-4191 size-medium" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Kentucky&#x2019;s-Senate-Bill-6-Can-Only-Harm-Injury-Victims-300x200.jpg" alt="Tort Reform in Ohio: Good for Rapists, Bad for Victims" width="300" height="200">The people of Ohio were sold a bill of goods more than 10 years ago, when legislators allowed for &#x201C;tort reform&#x201D; &#x2013; a euphemism for damage caps in civil lawsuits. They told the people that lawyers and juries were out of control, and that placing caps on the amount of damages a person can collect in a civil suit would lead to &#x201C;a fair, predictable system of civil justice.&#x201D; It&#x2019;s predictable, all right: now, people who have been grievously injured, who may need medical care or counseling or life-altering therapies and household adaptations, can predict exactly when they&#x2019;ll be on their own to pay for those things out of pocket.

In the years that followed, Ohioans have suffered over and over and over again because of tort reform. A recent case, <em>Simpkins v. Grace Brethren</em>,&#xA0;shows just how awful the effects of tort reform can be. In short, because of these laws, a child who was repeatedly raped by a church pastor was denied a fair and just settlement. Tort reform at its finest, it appears.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law co-founder Marc Pera explains in detail just why tort reform is so dangerous and damaging to victims in this <a href="http://www.cincinnati.com/story/opinion/contributors/2016/12/20/ohio-tort-reform-helps-protect-rapists/95527218/">letter published by the <em>Cincinnati Enquirer</em></a>. We encourage you to read it, and to reach out to your legislators and representatives to demand the repeal of tort reform in Ohio. All it&#x2019;s done is allow those who hurt others to go largely unpunished, while taking money and treatments out of the hands of the people who need them the most &#x2013; the victims.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law provides comprehensive representation to personal injury and medical malpractice victims throughout Ohio and Kentucky. To learn more about our services, or to speak with an attorney, please call our Ohio team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">fill out our contact form</a>.

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: There Is No Excuse for How Walgreens Charges for Medication
BASENAME: no-excuse-walgreens-charges-medication
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 12/20/2016 11:06:51 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5265" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/medication-300x199.jpg" alt="There Is No Excuse for How Walgreens Charges for Medication" width="300" height="199">At this point, it&#x2019;s fairly common knowledge that medical procedures in hospitals are determined on a case-by-case basis. The hospital claims that this is because different agreements are worked out with different insurance companies, but in reality it is the best and most profitable system for the healthcare industry. The simple answer should be that an MRI machine costs so much to buy, staff, and maintain, and those costs are spread out over an average number of patients. The reality is that there is often no answer until your insurance coverage is confirmed.

While this is behavior we have come to expect from hospitals and doctors (who base their pricing under the guise of covering the exorbitant and rising cost of malpractice insurance they are required to carry because of overly litigious patients), we wouldn&#x2019;t expect the same type of behavior from our neighborhood pharmacy. After all, the cost of a pill is the same to everyone; there is a definite production cost, an expected markup, and that&#x2019;s the end. Unless, that is, you choose Walgreens as your pharmacy of choice.

<a href="http://www.khou.com/news/health/why-does-walgreens-charge-1237-more-than-costco/357124547">KHOU.com</a> published a story in late November that detailed one woman&#x2019;s experience with her husband&#x2019;s recent Alzheimer&#x2019;s diagnosis. Corinne and her husband Ken left the doctor&#x2019;s office with the devastating diagnosis and a prescription for Donepezil, a drug that increases cognition and behavior but doesn&#x2019;t cure or slow the disease. Ken&#x2019;s Medicare doesn&#x2019;t cover prescription drugs, so Corinne was prepared to pay cash for the 30 tablets &#x2013; but not for the amount she was charged.

A month&#x2019;s supply of Donepezil at Walgreens cost the couple $198.80 with no insurance subsidy. When Corinne started questioning how the medication could be so expensive, she began shopping around. Not long after, she found the same amount of the drug, a month&#x2019;s supply, cost a mere $14.87. Walgreens charged the couple <strong>1,237% more than a competitor</strong> just down the road.
<h2>How can this happen?</h2>
As usual, it comes down to insurance and greed: &#x201C;Most customers of the major chain drug stores have insurance, and insurance companies negotiate prices that are discounted from a store&#x2019;s list price. Therefore, the chains attach the list price to a rocket and launch it skyward &#x2014; and to heck with the poor schlubs like Corrine, who pay out of pocket.&#x201D; The article concludes that Walgreens isn&#x2019;t actually at the corner of healthy and happy; instead, it&#x2019;s at the intersection of &#x201C;Highway&#x201D; and &#x201C;Robbery.&#x201D;

Corrine contacted Walgreens and received no explanation, but she was offered a full refund. Those of us who don&#x2019;t check, or don&#x2019;t have time to check, end up being price-gouged &#x2013; and we simply carry on, grumbling about the prices without discovering that we have been had. The friendly neighborhood pharmacy turns out to be not-so-friendly after all. A Walgreens spokesman defended the company by saying that 97% of patients use some form of insurance, but that shouldn&#x2019;t mean the other 3% get raked over the coals.

Pricing is a major issue in the field of healthcare, and negligent or unethical business practices can harm your family just as much as negligent or unethical care. If your loved one has suffered in any way from the negligence of a healthcare professional, you may be entitled to compensation. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Ohio team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, or contact us today for a free consultation.

&#xA0;

&#xA0;

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: A &#x201C;Sod&#x201D; Story About Catastrophic Tire Failure
BASENAME: sod-story-catastrophic-tire-failure
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 12/27/2016 12:38:05 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5312" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/A-&#x201C;Sod&#x201D;-Story-About-Catastrophic-Tire-Failure-300x200.jpg" alt="a-sod-story-about-catastrophic-tire-failure" width="300" height="200">In <a href="http://www.whio.com/news/local/tire-failure-blamed-for-truck-crash-ohio-235-clark-county/vwMOKtlK0BwZATbwWoPLVI/">early November</a>, a commercial truck carrying several pallets of fresh sod rolled off state Route 235 in Bethel Township after a tire failure. The driver, who has strong roots in the community, was shaken but not injured. The truck itself rolled over, leading to a considerable traffic jam at the time.

Cargo spills get a lot of attention in the lighter section of the news; puns are fun, and we&#x2019;ve been guilty of our fair share in the past. Just this past June, we wrote about some of the strangest commercial truck cargo spills we&#x2019;ve ever come across. We enjoyed that list ourselves, but the real effects of commercial cargo spills are no laughing matter; the resulting road conditions can have catastrophic consequences for you and your loved ones.

Oddly enough, it was around this time last year that we wrote about the big risks of big tire blowouts. That post described how commercial trucks often use retreaded tires to save money, and how those retreaded tires are far more likely to fail at highway speeds than new tires. Exploding tires directly <a href="http://www.cbsnews.com/news/big-rig-fatal-accidents-linked-driving-trucks-over-75-mph-top-speed/">caused 223 deaths</a> between 2009 and 2013. We talked about how those tires behave on big rigs, but never discussed the impact a tire explosion at highway speeds could have on smaller (but still big) commercial vehicles.

The fact that no one was injured is truly extraordinary, especially considering that even this smaller commercial truck could have caused serious damage to any passenger vehicle in its path, and led to serious injuries for the passengers themselves. When any component of a big truck fails, the consequences can be dire for other motorists. Insurance is designed to protect you when accidents happen, but sometimes it isn&#x2019;t enough to cover all of the damages. When it isn&#x2019;t, you&#x2019;ll need a skilled truck accident attorney to help fight for you.

Experienced legal counsel is designed to protect you from what happens after an accident. When you are left with significant bills or injuries after an accident, you may be entitled to compensation for those bills, lost wages, continuing care or other damages. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio commercial truck accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. For a free consultation, call our Ohio team at 877.686.8879, or Kentucky team at 877.651.7764 or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us </a>today.

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Evaluating A Medical Negligence Case
BASENAME: evaluating-medical-negligence-case
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 12/30/2016 11:04:27 AM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HDPdGMQRsFc" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

When a client comes to me to have a medical negligence case evaluated, the first and most important thing is that they need answers. A lot of times people come for an evaluation and they&#x2019;ve had a bad result, but they don&#x2019;t know what happened. The care provider hasn&#x2019;t told them what happened. So initially, I think the goal is to get records and I think provide an explanation to the family what happened.

They always ask me, well what is medical negligence? And it&#x2019;s pretty simple; there&#x2019;s an expected way care providers are supposed to act. That&#x2019;s called the standard of care. If the care provider has acted below that, then they&#x2019;re negligent. We both provide the answer and then give them the evaluation of whether there&#x2019;s negligence or not.

Once you establish negligence, that&#x2019;s not the end of the evaluation. You also have to prove causation and damages. The easiest way to look at causation is, did that bad care directly cause the injury? In most cases, it did, but we have to evaluate that question. And then lastly, for a malpractice case to be successful, there has to be significant damages. In order for a jury to react to your case, it has to be a case involving wrongful death, paralysis, brain injury, or the loss of a limb.

In a legal sense, negligence is a failure to use reasonable care that results in injury or damages to another. Simply put, reasonable care means that most people with the same qualifications would have acted a certain way in a given situation. When healthcare providers fail to provide a reasonable standard of care, the consequences are more serious than in other professions because healthcare providers care for people.

Establishing medical negligence isn&#x2019;t as straightforward as it might seem. In some cases, like abdominal surgeries, a certain amount of risk is inherent in the procedure. In order for an action to be considered negligent, your healthcare provider must have committed a gross error or failed to adhere to established protocols before, during or after your surgery. Retaining experienced legal counsel after a botched procedure or diagnosis will help you get the answers you need as quickly as possible.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our experienced team of medical and legal professionals is uniquely suited to evaluate the circumstances of your case and to help you take the legal steps necessary to recover. If you believe that you or a loved one has been a victim of medical negligence, our Kentucky and Ohio medical malpractice and medical negligence lawyers can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you need. For a free consultation, call us in Ohio at 877.686.8879, in Kentucky at 877.651.7764, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us </a>today.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: At Long Last, Some Good News from 2016
BASENAME: long-last-good-news-2016
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 01/10/2017 02:55:53 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5382" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/At-Long-Last-Some-Good-News-from-2016-300x200.jpg" alt="at-long-last-some-good-news-from-2016" width="300" height="200">The last few days of 2016 were a rollercoaster ride for the ages; the year claimed so many prominent public figures that a GoFundMe page was started to protect Betty White for the remainder of the year. The slings and arrows continued to fly right up until the very end, making for a Christmas miracle that one Ohio family will never forget.
<h2>An un-survivable accident</h2>
Just two days before Christmas, first responders were called to an early morning crash site in Luzerne Country involving a tractor-trailer wreck and vehicle entrapment. WNEP 16 reported, &#x201C;As... [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent=&quot;yes&quot; overflow=&quot;visible&quot;][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type=&quot;1_1&quot; background_position=&quot;left top&quot; background_color=&quot;&quot; border_size=&quot;&quot; border_color=&quot;&quot; border_style=&quot;solid&quot; spacing=&quot;yes&quot; background_image=&quot;&quot; background_repeat=&quot;no-repeat&quot; padding=&quot;&quot; margin_top=&quot;0px&quot; margin_bottom=&quot;0px&quot; class=&quot;&quot; id=&quot;&quot; animation_type=&quot;&quot; animation_speed=&quot;0.3&quot; animation_direction=&quot;left&quot; hide_on_mobile=&quot;no&quot; center_content=&quot;no&quot; min_height=&quot;none&quot;][Hanover Township Fire Chief Joe Temarantz] drove his ambulance down Nuangola hill towards the scene of the wreck, he saw tire tracks, twisted metal, and shredded rubber all over the road. He later learned that the car that was wedged beneath the tractor trailer was dragged for more than a quarter of a mile.&#x201D;

The trail of debris strewn across the highway led first responders to expect the worst, but when they arrived, the mangled car was empty. The family of four sitting on a nearby embankment were not onlookers; the parents and two young children were in the accidents. They had escaped certain death almost entirely unscathed; all four were released from a nearby hospital just hours later. Chief Temarantz remembered the father telling his child not to worry about the Christmas presents inside the car because their real present had just happened.
<h2>The impossible can happen</h2>
This particular underride crash was unusual mostly because the victims survived at all. When a passenger vehicle travels under a tractor-trailer at highway speeds, catastrophic injuries and death are the most common results. The guards design to prevent underride incursion have caused decapitation and penetration injuries, and the other forces involved have caused brain and spinal cord injuries and bone and tissue damage that are either fatal or require a lifetime of rehabilitation.

This family of four truly experienced a Christmas miracle; it&#x2019;s uncommon for the victims of commercial truck accidents to walk away at all, let alone with nary a scratch. More often, families lose loved ones or watch them cling to life as medical professionals struggle to repair severe injuries. When accidents affect your family, there is no substitute for experienced legal counsel. The qualified Kentucky and Ohio commercial truck accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help your family get the compensation they deserve. For a free consultation, call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us today</a>.[/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Investigating Birth Injuries
BASENAME: investigating-birth-injuries
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 01/05/2017 02:21:22 PM
-----
BODY:
<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/imfGSHG_FRg" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>

A birth injury case starts with one of the most dreaded things in anyone&#x2019;s life and that is an injury to a child. But what people don&apos;t realize initially is that injury to the child could actually have happened during the various stages of the pregnancy. So, an evaluation of the prenatal period, which is before the delivery occurs, as well as during the labor and delivery and even after the baby is born, that evaluation has to take place from start to finish.

Anytime a family comes to me for investigation of a birth injury case, the electronic fetal monitoring strips are very important. Initially, when you look at these strips, and they&apos;re actually records that are created during the labor and delivery process, it shows the baby&#x2019;s heart rate, it shows Mom&#x2019;s contraction pattern. When you first look at them they look complicated. But actually when you sit down and review them with a family, you see that it is very common sense.

It shows the baby&#x2019;s heart rate, so you can evaluate whether the baby is healthy, whether the baby is undergoing distress during the labor such that the doctor should intervene. It also shows Mom&#x2019;s contraction pattern, so you can also see if the contractions were strong, whether they are adequate, or whether there are too many of those contractions, which can also affect the baby.

So when I sit down with the baby family and review the electronic fetal monitoring strips themselves, they can actually see what occurred during the labor and delivery and they can get the answers to what happened to their baby by reviewing those strips together.

A birth injury is something that no one parent wants to think about. When a birth injury affects your family, it can be difficult to think, let alone consider that your child&#x2019;s injury may have been the result of a mistake made by a healthcare provider that you trusted. At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our team of medical and legal professionals on Ohio and Kentucky have the experience to evaluate your case and help you get through a difficult time. We fight for your family when you need us most.
<h2>We get the answers you need</h2>
The first step in evaluating a birth injury is examining the medical records of treatment and testing from conception to delivery. Our team is uniquely suited to examine complicated medical records and determine whether procedure was followed, even when complications necessitated alternative treatment. We examine every facet of every stage of pregnancy, labor, delivery postpartum and neonatal care, and we make sure that negligent care providers are held accountable. Most importantly, we review our findings with you and keep you involved at every stage.

If your child suffered a birth injury that resulted in temporary or permanent effects, it&#x2019;s easy to believe that your doctor and hospital did everything they could to prevent injury; sadly, that&#x2019;s not always the case. When your child suffers a birth injury, a professional legal review of the medical records can reveal problems and prevent mistakes from happening again. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky birth injury lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you need to pay for medical bills and continuing care. Call 877.651.7764 for our Kentucky team, 877.686.8879 for our Ohio team, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today for a free consultation.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Your Crash Risk Doubles for Every Hour of Sleep You Lose
BASENAME: crash-risk-doubles-every-hour-sleep-lose
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 01/04/2017 08:25:15 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5371" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Your-Crash-Risk-Doubles-for-Every-Hour-of-Sleep-You-Lose-300x200.jpg" alt="your-crash-risk-doubles-for-every-hour-of-sleep-you-lose" width="300" height="200">It&#x2019;s not news; distracted and fatigued driving cause accidents and cost lives. We talk about distracted driving all the time because the evidence is plain; studies have found that texting and driving is just as dangerous as driving under the influence. Now it appears that fatigued driving should join the dynamic duo of distracted and drunk driving to become the terrible trifecta. New data suggests that all three conditions contribute to roughly the same number of crashes.

It gets worse NPR News reported:

&#x201C;A report released Tuesday by the AAA Foundation for Traffic Safety suggests that drivers who sleep only five or six hours in a 24-hour period are twice as likely to crash as drivers who get seven hours of sleep or more.

And the less sleep the person behind the wheel gets, the higher the crash rate, according to the findings. For instance, drivers in the study who got only four or five hours of shut-eye had four times the crash rate &#x2014; close to what&apos;s seen among drunken drivers.&#x201D;

We just recently talked about how distracted driving caused the biggest spike in highway fatalities in fifty years. In the first six months of 2016, highway fatalities were up more than 10 percent from the same period in 2015, when more than 35,000 people died on the road. Our nations roadways are no longer getting safer. Instead, lack of attention, lack of sleep, and poor judgment are increasing the risks for drivers everywhere.

How to stay safe

Fortunately, there&#x2019;s good news for the chronically busy. You can catch up on lost sleep, but only to a point. The point, of course, is within the same day. If you sleep for four hours and then nap later during the same 24-hour period, you&#x2019;re generally in the clear. Unfortunately, the only way to catch up on sleep after the day resets is to get the rest your body needs. If you begin to feel fatigued on long drives or after a long day, the report suggests pulling over for a quick 10- or 20-minute nap; that break could be the difference between life and death.

Auto and truck accidents change lives in an instant. New data is pouring in all the time that tells us how many are affected and what the contributing causes are, but all that information makes the same point; driving requires our full attention all of the time. One mistake, even at low speeds, can kill. Unfortunately, being a safe driver doesn&#x2019;t mean that everyone else is taking the same precaution.

If you or your loved one has been a victim of a distracted, drunk, or fatigued driver, you may be entitled to compensation for medical bills, lost wages and other damages. The experienced Ohio and Kentucky auto accident attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. Call our Kentucky team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio team at 877.686.8879 or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today
