AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: What We Can Learn from the Akron House Explosion That Rocked Residents for Miles
BASENAME: can-learn-akron-house-explosion-rocked-residents-miles
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 03/30/2017 02:39:22 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5785" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/What-We-Can-Learn-from-the-Akron-House-Explosion-That-Rocked-Residents-for-Miles-300x200.jpg" alt="what-we-can-learn-from-the-akron-house-explosion-that-rocked-residents-for-miles" width="300" height="200">At 7:38pm on Tuesday, February 7, it was business as usual in West Akron. Jeopardy was still in the first round for the evening, and bedtime was a mere twenty minutes away for dozens of grade school students. A minute later, the world rocked on its foundations for almost 30 square miles; a house at the corner of Courtland Avenue and South Hawkins Avenue had violently exploded. First responders found the structure virtually flattened and an unidentified man in his 30s bleeding and covered in burns in the yard.
<h2>A massive explosion</h2>
The Akron Beacon Journal reported, &#x201C;Firefighters are investigating, but [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent=&quot;yes&quot; overflow=&quot;visible&quot;][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type=&quot;1_1&quot; background_position=&quot;left top&quot; background_color=&quot;&quot; border_size=&quot;&quot; border_color=&quot;&quot; border_style=&quot;solid&quot; spacing=&quot;yes&quot; background_image=&quot;&quot; background_repeat=&quot;no-repeat&quot; padding=&quot;&quot; margin_top=&quot;0px&quot; margin_bottom=&quot;0px&quot; class=&quot;&quot; id=&quot;&quot; animation_type=&quot;&quot; animation_speed=&quot;0.3&quot; animation_direction=&quot;left&quot; hide_on_mobile=&quot;no&quot; center_content=&quot;no&quot; min_height=&quot;none&quot;][Akron Fire Department spokesman Michael] Brooks said the explosion was likely caused by natural gas. People were evacuated from nearby homes, and gas and electric workers were on the scene as late at 9:30 p.m. trying to cut off the gas as the fire burned on.&#x201D;

It was determined that the explosion was most likely intentionally caused by the man first responders rescued from the yard. That man, one Rodney Hylton, was charged with aggravated arson (a first-degree felony) and later admitted to tampering with his stove&#x2019;s gas burners and a gas cap in an attempt at self-harm. Luckily, no one other than Hylton was injured in the explosion. However, the incident does serve to highlight a little known fact about natural gas lines; namely, that gas leaks are everywhere.
<h2>Infrastructure isn&#x2019;t just bridges and tunnels</h2>
Last year, Nicholas Kawa wrote an article for <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2015/09/gas-leaks-are-everywhere/405820/">The Atlantic</a> about his experience checking gas lines in Chicago suburbs during high school. He was surprised to learn that, &#x201C;The bulk of the gas leaks identified are left leaking. Those between five to 15 feet from a house or structure would receive a check-up after six months. Leaks more than 15 feet from a building were noted but required no special attention. Many of the leaks persisted for years and even decades.&#x201D;

Luckily, natural gas explosions are fairly rare; leaks generally have to occur in an enclosed space to have any chance of causing an explosion. When gas leaks do lead to an explosion, however, those explosions tend to cause catastrophic injuries. Natural gas explosions can cause concussion injuries and internal and external burns. However, it&#x2019;s not just the heat and force of the concussion that cause problems; an explosion sets up a shockwave that propagates through the air around it. These shockwaves travel at tremendous speeds and move through anything in their path; objects are thrown, glass is shattered, and every object in the immediate area becomes a dangerous projectile. Whether explosions are an act of arson or an act of God, serious injuries are often the result.

If your loved one was seriously injured because of someone else&#x2019;s negligence, you may be entitled to compensation for medical bills, lost wages and other damages. The experienced Ohio catastrophic injury lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. For a free consultation, call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879 or <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact us</a> today.

AUTHOR: Marc Pera
TITLE: The ABA Stands with Patients: HR 1215 is Dangerous
BASENAME: aba-stands-patients-hr-1215-dangerous
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 03/29/2017 04:53:32 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-full wp-image-5791" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/washington-mcgowan-350.jpg" alt="washington-mcgowan-350" width="350" height="201">The American Bar Association has more than 400,000 members, and it one of the largest voluntary organizations in the world. When the group takes a stand, it does so knowing that it has the power of nearly half a million people behind it. That is why this letter from Thomas M. Susman, Director of the ABA&#x2019;s Governmental Affairs Office, to Chairman Bob Goodlatte and Ranking Member John Coyers, Jr., of the House Judiciary Committee, expressing opposition to HR 1215: Protecting Access to Care Act of 2017, is so powerful &#x2013; and so important.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law has gone on record stating the dangers of HR 1215, and we stand with the ABA. The myth of tort reform as a measure for good is pervasive, and fighting it has been an uphill battle. Despite ample evidence to the contrary, legislators in this country still believe the lies that &#x201C;frivolous&#x201D; lawsuits are contributing in any way to the rising costs of healthcare.

In fact, a new study shows paid medical <a href="https://medicalxpress.com/news/2017-03-paid-medical-malpractice-decrease.html" target="_blank">malpractice claims are decreasing</a>, not increasing. Tort reform was dreamed up by the <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/stevecohen/2015/03/02/on-tort-reform-its-time-to-declare-victory-and-withdraw/#6e60ee9363ea" target="_blank">insurance companies</a> as a way to avoid accountability to their own customers. Medical malpractice lawsuits contribute to, at best, <a href="http://www.latimes.com/business/hiltzik/la-fi-mh-another-study-shows-why-tort-reform--20140919-column.html" target="_blank">2% to 3%</a> of the cost of healthcare. The only thing tort reform will reliably do is hurt victims.

HR 1215 has nothing to do with helping people and everything to do with helping negligent doctors and insurance companies avoid accountability by, among other things:
<ul>
    <li>Limiting all non-economic damages to $250,000, regardless of the severity of the injury</li>
    <li>Making all claims federal claims, thus preempting states&#x2019; rights</li>
    <li>Limiting the amount the victim&#x2019;s attorney can be paid, with no limitation on the amount the doctor or his/her insurer can pay their lawyer</li>
</ul>
We encourage you to read the full text of the letter to the committee, and take a stand with us and with the American bar Association. Please <a href="http://www.house.gov/representatives/find/" target="_blank">contact your representatives</a> and tell them that patients matter more than paychecks. Vote No on HR 1215, and protect your rights, and the rights of victims throughout the country.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: New Bill Would Remove Effective Checks on Medical Malpractice
BASENAME: new-bill-remove-effective-checks-medical-malpractice
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 03/28/2017 07:27:36 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5778" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/New-Bill-Would-Remove-Effective-Checks-on-Medical-Malpractice-300x200.jpg" alt="new-bill-would-remove-effective-checks-on-medical-malpractice" width="300" height="200">The new federal Congress in Washington is now considering passage of a bill that would limit the right of injured victims in health-related cases to get more than $250,000 in non-economic damages. Any newborn whose life is tragically altered because a birth doctor&#x2019;s negligence caused the newborn to have cerebral palsy, or any person who is paralyzed for life because of medical error, will only be allowed at most a quarter million dollars for a life-time of suffering. If a doctor fails to diagnose cancer, thus preventing early detection that could have saved the patient&#x2019;s life, the most the cancer victim can ever get is $250,000.
<h2>Economic and non-economic damages</h2>
Economic damages are the medical costs to pay for hospital surgeries, doctor visits, and medications necessitated by medical errors. Economic damages can also include the amount of income a victim loses because of the doctor&#x2019;s or hospital&#x2019;s negligence.

Non-economic damage compensates a patient for severely altering his or her quality of life through error or negligence. It includes:
<ul>
    <li>The daily physical bodily pains and aches that can be excruciating for some victims.</li>
    <li>The loss of life&#x2019;s pleasures, such as being able to teach a child, go to a baseball game with that child, or even walking a daughter down the aisle for her wedding.</li>
    <li>The emotional anxiety of worrying about one&#x2019;s health and how a person will need to rely on others for assistance.</li>
    <li>Depression, anxiety, and fear that often accompany catastrophic and serious injuries.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Lack of accountability</h2>
The dangers this new law proposes go beyond the rights of those who place their lives in the hands of doctors, hospitals, and nurses only to see their lives cut short or made worse. Fundamentally, economic damage awards are the only way to police bad doctors and poor hospitals.

It is the possibility and the reality of large damage awards&#x2014;that our Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys are adept at obtaining&#x2014;that make hospitals take the necessary steps to:
<ul>
    <li>Train their doctors and medical staff</li>
    <li>Make sure they have the best medical equipment</li>
    <li>Comply with federal, state, and local guidelines</li>
    <li>Meet the demands of federal and state medical associations</li>
</ul>
Medical malpractice law holds doctors accountable to:
<ul>
    <li>Stay current with the latest medical techniques</li>
    <li>Run through the full check-list of necessary and likely issues that may arise during surgery</li>
    <li>Get the right diagnosis</li>
    <li>Prepare properly for surgery</li>
    <li>Prescribe the correct treatment</li>
</ul>
$250,000 is simply not a sufficient deterrent. Most doctors and hospitals pay for insurance. While the premiums are high, they are supposed to be for a reason&#x2014;to make sure mistakes don&#x2019;t happen. Insurance companies have penalized doctors for making mistakes by demanding much higher premiums if mistakes are made or denying coverage altogether if it is clear the health care provider has a history of negligence.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we have seen how medical malpractice ruins lives. We believe limiting economic awards harms people who need the most help. We assert that a full jury award is the only way to prevent doctors and hospitals from harming not only our clients but all patients who visit a hospital or doctor.

To learn how we are trying to fight this unfair law and how you can help, please contact us at any time. You can reach our team of Ohio lawyers at 877-686-8879 and our team of Kentucky attorneys at 877-686-8879. You can also reach us through our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Diagnostic Errors Are a Leading Cause of Medical Malpractice
BASENAME: diagnostic-errors-leading-cause-medical-malpractice
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/04/2017 11:52:57 AM
-----
BODY:
Before doctors or hospitals can prescribe any treatment, they have to know what it is wrong with the patient. They are supposed to be trained on which tests&#x2014;depending on the patient&#x2019;s symptoms and medical history&#x2014;to perform to make a proper diagnosis. Health care providers must read and assess those tests correctly. Physicians who make diagnostic errors can cause the patient to die, to suffer until the correct diagnosis is made, or to undergo unnecessary treatments and procedures.
<h2>Types of diagnostic errors</h2>
Health care providers can make the following types of health care mistakes:
<ul>
    <li><strong>An improper diagnosis or misdiagnosis.</strong> Doctors who make the wrong diagnosis of your illness don&#x2019;t provide the right treatments and don&#x2019;t correct your medical problems.</li>
    <li><strong>A failure to diagnose.</strong> Here the physician fails to make any diagnosis of your medical problem. He/she fails to recognize that you have cancer, for example.</li>
    <li><strong>A delay in the diagnosis</strong>. Delays in diagnosing a medical condition can cause your body to deteriorate and the disease to accelerate. Treatments that would have worked if the diagnosis was made quickly may fail when the diagnosis is too late. Delays are often caused by a failure to order MRIs, blood work, biopsies, or other tests in a timely manner.</li>
</ul>
Diagnostic errors include failure to read the test results correctly, using improper equipment, mixing up your blood work with that of another patient, and many other errors. Competent Ohio medical malpractice lawyers work with experienced medical professional to determine if a diagnostic error occurred.
<h2>Medical conditions that are often worsened by diagnostic error</h2>
A defective diagnosis at best means that additional surgeries, treatments, and medications will be required. At worst, it means a patient never fully recovers or dies. Some common examples of diagnostic error are:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Cardiology errors.</strong> Patients with chest pains, dizziness, and other heart attack or stroke symptoms should be treated for heart disease and not heartburn or migraines. Quick attention can save a life.</li>
    <li>A failure to order the right tests, such as biopsies, can delay the necessary treatment. The difference between treating stage-2 cancer and stage-3 cancer can be the difference between life and death.</li>
    <li>Chest X-Rays are not the sole determining factor in diagnosing or ruling out pneumonia. A full set of appropriate tests should be ordered if pneumonia is suspected.</li>
    <li><strong>Cerebral Palsy (CP).</strong> This condition is often diagnosed incorrectly. Some children with CP are not properly diagnosed and some children who don&#x2019;t have CP are mistakenly diagnosed with the condition.</li>
    <li><strong>Fungal lung infections.</strong> This condition, also called aspergillosis, is often misdiagnosed.</li>
</ul>
Sometimes, the correct diagnosis has to be made during surgery. A failure to treat the right problem, during pregnancy for example, can lead to birth defects, infections, preeclampsia, and endanger the life of the child and the mother.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice lawyers have helped many medical malpractice patients get justice in the form of multi-million dollar verdicts against doctors and hospitals who commit medical error.

If you suspect medical malpractice harmed you or a loved one, please call our lawyers at 877-686-8879 in Ohio and 877-686-8879 in Kentucky. You can also reach us through our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a>. We take cases on a contingency fee basis.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: What Are Commercial Vehicles, and Why Are They So Dangerous?
BASENAME: commercial-vehicles-dangerous
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/14/2017 10:45:01 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6019" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/truck-accident-300x194.jpg" alt="Truck Accident" width="300" height="194">Many Ohio and Kentucky truck accidents are caused by commercial vehicles. Commercial vehicles are different than other cars and smaller trucks. Drivers of commercial vehicles must have a commercial driver&#x2019;s license (CDL). Generally, a driver who obtains an Ohio commercial driver&#x2019;s license can drive in Kentucky and every other U.S. state (and vice versa). In order to obtain and keep a commercial driver&#x2019;s license:
<ul>
    <li>The driver must complete an approved CDL training course</li>
    <li>The commercial driver must pass a test that meets federal and state standards</li>
    <li>The driver must have an approved medical authorization</li>
    <li>The driver&#x2019;s license must match the particular class of truck he/she is driving</li>
</ul>
Commercial drivers must meet additional requirements. Violations of these requirements can be useful in proving that the driver and the company that hired the driver were responsible for a truck accident. For example, most drivers who are pulled over for drunk driving will be found guilty if their blood alcohol content was .08. Commercial drivers can be found guilty if their blood alcohol content was just .04.

Commercial drivers must also comply with the federal and state driving laws that regulate how much the truck can weigh, how much rest the driver should get, how the truck cargo should be secured, and other safety factors. These safety rules apply to drivers on federal and state roads, such as Ohio Routes 23 and 33, Interstates 76, 75, and 480; the Western Kentucky Parkway, Kentucky Routes 7 and 9, and all other truck route roads.
<h2>Commercial truck classifications</h2>
Commercial vehicles are classified based on the following criteria:
<ul>
    <li>The Gross Vehicle Weight Rating of the truck</li>
    <li>Whether hazardous materials are being transported</li>
    <li>How many passengers are being transported</li>
</ul>
Commercial vehicles include semi-trucks, 18-wheelers, rigs, heavy trucks, vans, buses, tractor-trailers, and other large vehicles. When commercial vehicle accidents occur, the injuries that car passengers and motorcycle riders suffer are often deadly or quite severe. The weight, size, and dimensions of these commercial vehicles are simply no match for smaller automobiles and lighter vehicles.

If you were injured in a truck accident, our Ohio and Kentucky truck accident attorneys are experienced litigators. We understand what is needed to prove fault and all the damages that should be paid. You can reach our Ohio attorneys at 877-686-8879 and our Kentucky lawyers at 877-686-8879. You can also use our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a> to schedule an appointment.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Psychological and Emotional Damages in Kentucky Catastrophic Injury Cases
BASENAME: psychological-emotional-damages-kentucky-catastrophic-injury-cases
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/11/2017 01:41:27 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6015" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Kentucky-Catastrophic-Injury-300x213.jpg" alt="Kentucky catastrophic injury" width="300" height="213">A catastrophic injury is one that changes an accident victim&#x2019;s life forever. It changes their ability to function, to think, to communicate, and to socialize. It impacts their ability to perform daily physical activities. Catastrophic injuries include traumatic brain injury, spinal cord damage, paralysis, severe burns, loss of a limb, and permanent injuries. These severe injuries can be caused by vehicle accidents, accidents in the workplace, product defects, explosions, construction accidents, and other incidents.
<h2>Pain and suffering</h2>
In every type of accident, the victim has to endure substantial emotional issues as they attempt to heal. Common emotional trauma includes:
<ul>
    <li>Shock at realizing their stable life has now become unstable</li>
    <li>Anger at the people who caused the accident</li>
    <li>Anxiety about the status of their health</li>
    <li>Fear that they could experience another injury, or that a love one could be injured</li>
    <li>Distress at the toll their injuries are taking on family members</li>
    <li>Frustration at the inability to enjoy and teach children, spend time with parents, and live a daily mature life with their spouse</li>
</ul>
Many victims endure this suffering on their own. Some are able to get help from psychologists, psychiatrists, and counselors
<h2>Why catastrophic Injuries are uniquely traumatic</h2>
For patients who are able to fully heal or resume most of their life&#x2019;s activities, the suffering does come to an end. For people with life-altering physical damages, the suffering will last for every day of the rest of their lives. Patients with catastrophic injuries sometimes need professional help to cope with the following issues and more, depending on their situation:
<ul>
    <li><strong>All of the problems other patients have &#x2013; but for a lifetime</strong>. This includes depression, confusion, and generally withdrawing from the world.</li>
    <li><strong>Thoughts of suicide.</strong> Victims who will never walk, talk, have physical relations, or who have body disfigurement sometimes think that life is not worth living.</li>
    <li><strong>Alcoholism and addiction.</strong> Many accident victims cope the wrong way &#x2013; by resorting to methods that they think provide relief but only worsen the harm, such as drugs and alcohol.</li>
</ul>
Patients who lose a limb may suffer phantom pain &#x2013; pain in the missing limb that is real in their mind. Some accident victims suffer post-traumatic stress disorder.

Verifying these extreme emotional difficulties requires that Kentucky catastrophic injury lawyers do more than work with the appropriate mental health professionals. Legal representatives must work with the victim by helping him/her explain what their daily life is like, with family members who can detail the victim&#x2019;s struggles, and with the physicians and doctors who can detail the physical cause of their pain.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our attorneys do all of this and more. If someone you love was severely injured or you are living with a catastrophic injury, we have decades of trial experience. For compassionate help, please call our Kentucky lawyers at 877-686-8879 or use our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a> to make an appointment. We see patients away from the office when necessary.

EXCERPT:

-----
KEYWORDS:

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Doctors and Hospitals Should Take Precautions to Prevent Cerebral Palsy
BASENAME: doctors-hospitals-take-precautions-prevent-cerebral-palsy
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/07/2017 03:29:27 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6012" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Doctor-talking-to-patient-300x226.jpg" alt="Doctors and Hospitals Should Take Precautions to Prevent Cerebral Palsy" width="300" height="226">Cerebral palsy (CP) is a medical condition caused by brain damage that can forever alter the life of a newborn. &#x201C;Cerebral&#x201D; refers to the brain. &#x201C;Palsy&#x201D; refers to motor impairment. CP can range from mild to severe depending on the amount of damage to the brain.

If brain damage was caused during birth, and the medical professionals involved failed to take reasonable precautionary steps, these health providers can be held accountable for the lifetime of physical harm and emotional distress that this devastating condition causes. Our lawyers work with trained obstetricians and other doctors to determine what preventive measures should have been taken.

CP can result from untreated fetal distress, compression of the umbilical cord, the newborn being unable to comfortably pass through the birth canal, lack of oxygen to the brain, infection, and a shearing of the placenta. These problems should be anticipated and corrected by the birthing team to prevent any brain damage from occurring. Newborns and mothers should be constantly monitored before, during, and after the birth. Sometimes, a Caesarian section (C-section) is the best option to prevent complications.
<h2>Cerebral Palsy complications</h2>
According to <a href="http://www.cerebralpalsysource.com">Cerebral Palsy Source</a>, the problems individuals with CP experience depend on what part of their brain was damaged. The following difficulties are common:
<ul>
    <li>Spasticity or tightness of the muscles</li>
    <li>Difficulty walking</li>
    <li>Difficulty swallowing</li>
    <li>Involuntary movements</li>
    <li>Speech, hearing, and visual problems</li>
    <li>Seizures</li>
    <li>Cognitive issues and learning disabilities</li>
</ul>
CP patients also may have problems with going to the bathroom, with breathing, and with their posture. Many also have disorders of the skin and pressure sores because of immobility issues.

Each year, there are about &#xBE; of a million children and adults who exhibit some form of CP. Close to 8,000 newborns are born with cerebral palsy. Many of these cases are due to birth injury malpractice.

The three main types of CP are:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Spastic CP.</strong> In this type of cerebral palsy, the muscle tissues are tight, causing problems with mobility.</li>
    <li><strong>Athetoid CP.</strong> This is also a movement disorder but, with this condition, movements and tics can&#x2019;t be controlled.</li>
    <li><strong>Ataxic</strong> People with this form of CP have balance and depth problems.</li>
</ul>
Mixed CP is a fourth classification reserved for children and adults who have some combination of the three main types.

Sadly, CP is not curable. There are treatments that can help, including physical therapy, wheelchairs, computer assistance, and medications.
<h2>United Cerebral Palsy Associations in Ohio</h2>
Three Ohio associations that help children and adults who are diagnosed with CP and their families are:
<ul>
    <li>UCP of Central Ohio, 440 Industrial Mile Road, Columbus, OH 43228-2411, Phone: (614) 279-0109</li>
    <li>UCP of Greater Cincinnati, 3601 Victory Parkway, Cincinnati, OH 45229, Phone: (513) 221-4606</li>
    <li>UCP of Greater Cleveland, 10011 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, OH 44106, Phone: (216) 791-8363</li>
</ul>
There are other associations that can provide education and support throughout Ohio.

Our Ohio birth injury malpractice attorneys understand just how devastating a cerebral palsy diagnosis is for the child and the parents. Medical professionals who do not take reasonable precautions to prevent the complications that result in CP must be held accountable. To speak to one our strong advocates today, please call the Ohio Crandall &amp; Pera Law office at 877-686-8879 or complete our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a>. We&#x2019;re ready to help you get justice.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: What Damages are Allowed in Ohio Wrongful Death Cases?
BASENAME: damages-allowed-ohio-wrongful-death-cases
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/18/2017 02:43:42 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6106" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Wrongful-Death-Lawyers-300x200.jpg" alt="wrongful death lawyers" width="300" height="200">The worst type of personal injury accident is one in which a beloved family member is killed. People can be killed because of a car accident, medical malpractice, defective products, or for many other reasons. The individuals and businesses responsible for these tragedies deserve to be held accountable for the loss of life they cause the victim. In Ohio, liable parties must also account for the lifetime of harm they cause the spouse, children, and parents because the life of a loved one was tragically and wrongfully cut short.
<h2>Ohio statutory damages</h2>
Wrongful death cases are brought by the personal representative of the victim&#x2019;s estate. If the victim had a will, then the personal representative is the executor/executrix named in the will. Otherwise, the personal representative is someone approved by the court&#x2014;typically a spouse, adult child, or parent.

The wrongdoers are liable for the following damages in wrongful death cases:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Funeral and burial costs.</strong> This sum is separate from the other damages.</li>
    <li><strong>The loss of financial support the accident victim would have reasonably provided the family.</strong> Typically, financial experts look at the decedent&#x2019;s work history, education, and skills to determine how much the person would have reasonably earned.</li>
    <li><strong>The loss of support the victim would have given the relatives.</strong> This includes items such as the value of housework and child care.</li>
    <li><strong>The loss of society of the decedent.</strong> This includes the loss of attention, protection, guidance, training, education, consortium (love and companionship), and other care that the spouse, children, or parents suffered.</li>
    <li><strong>The loss of any prospective inheritance to the victim&#x2019;s line of heirs</strong>. If, for example, a husband and father dies, any inheritance his parents or grandparents would have reasonably provided should be considered.</li>
</ul>
Another important measure of damages is the emotional anguish each relative who lost a loved one suffers.

Sometimes complex questions arise, such as what happens if a child was conceived before the victim&#x2019;s death but was born after death, or what happens if a spouse has remarried. An experienced Ohio wrongful death lawyer can readily answer these difficult questions.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our attorneys fight to give bereaved family members every dollar Ohio law allows. To make an appointment with one of our caring advocates, please call us at 877-686-8879 or fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: What Everyone Needs to Know About Fentanyl Patches
BASENAME: everyone-needs-know-fentanyl-patches
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/21/2017 11:22:11 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6104" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/fentanyl-patches-300x200.jpg" alt="Fentanyl" width="300" height="200">Most people don&#x2019;t think twice about the drugs in their cabinets, and many don&#x2019;t think twice about taking a prescription medication that wasn&#x2019;t prescribed to them. Think about it like this; you&#x2019;re at a friend&#x2019;s house and suddenly come down with a headache. They offer you a prescription ibuprofen or a Tylenol-3. Both are common medications, both are fairly similar and both are very likely to knock out that headache in short order. Most of us wouldn&#x2019;t think twice.
<h2>Only take medications prescribed for you</h2>
Some medications, particularly the ones most commonly prescribed to the elderly for chronic conditions or <a href="https://www.patientsrightsblog.com/first-decrease-american-life-expectancy-two-decades/" target="_blank">chronic pain management</a>, are far from innocuous. Taking one of grandma&#x2019;s pills for your headache might actually knock you out. Prescription drugs aren&#x2019;t a joke, and you shouldn&#x2019;t take anything that doesn&#x2019;t have your name on it specifically. Fentanyl patches (or pills, or lollipops, or any other formulation) are in a league of their own. The opioid is so potent that it can cause dizziness, nausea, vomiting, light-headedness and other symptoms in less than 20 minutes in those who don&#x2019;t need it.

Fentanyl is considered a necessary evil, but it carries serious risks. Simply having the patches around the house can put everyone at risk of accidental overdose; the drug is <em>eighty times</em> more potent than morphine. The patches are designed to release a controlled amount of the drug over time to be absorbed by the skin. If they are punctured or damaged in any way, direct exposure can quickly cause serious problems.
<h2>The real risk of chronic pain management</h2>
Worse, the drug is becoming the new hot item on the streets. Its potency has placed it in high demand, with addicts looking to cancer patients and the elderly as a supply. Whether your concern is properly caring for your loved one or watching out for signs of abuse, it pays to know what to look for. Seek emergency medical attention if you notice:
<ul>
    <li>Slow heart rate, sighing, weak or shallow breathing (up to several days after removing the skin patch)</li>
    <li>Chest pain, fast or pounding heartbeats</li>
    <li>Extreme drowsiness or dizziness</li>
</ul>
<ul>
    <li>Nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, loss of appetite, diarrhea, constipation</li>
</ul>
Unfortunately, when fentanyl is around, the problems only seem to increase. The drug can cause confusion and cognitive changes, and long-term use can lead to tolerance issues. Sudden cessation can cause addiction issues. When your loved one is prescribed fentanyl, constant communication is of the utmost importance. Doctors, patients, and family members should all be aware of the risks of fentanyl to both patients and others.

If chronic pain management has left your loved one with tolerance, hypersensitivity, or addiction issues, you may be entitled to compensation for medical malpractice. The experienced Kentucky and Ohio medical malpractice attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can evaluate your case and help get you the compensation you deserve. For a free consultation, call our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, or <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact us</a> today.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Non-tuberculous Mycobacteria Infections Caused by Sorin/ St&#xF6;ckert 3T Heater-Cooler Devices
BASENAME: non-tuberculous-mycobacteria-infections-caused-sorin-stockert-3t-heater-cooler-devices
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/02/2017 02:00:35 PM
-----
BODY:
The Centers for Disease Control &amp; Prevention, and the U.S. Food &amp; Drug Administration, have been warning hospitals, medical centers, and doctors about contaminated heater-cooler devices used in cardiothoracic surgery. These devices appear to have left their manufacturing plant already contaminated with <em>non-tuberculous mycobacteria</em> (NTM), and a design defect is alleged to allow the bacteria to spread.
<h2>What are non-tuberculous mycobacteria?</h2>
NTM are slow-growing bacteria that are commonly found in soil and water samples. They are usually harmless, and most people will not be infected by these bacteria simply from touching the water or soil. However, when you develop an NTM infection which is goes undiagnosed and untreated, you could become very ill; in some cases, these bacteria have proven deadly.
<h2>How is the infection spreading?</h2>
The heater-cooler devices (HCDs) left their manufacturing plant in Germany already contaminated with bacteria, so the risk of infection already existed in any facility that uses Sorin/ St&#xF6;ckert 3T HCDs. The bacteria incubate in the water, and then aerosolize through the exhaust system. Even in cases where the doctors have done everything correctly, patients were at risk.

However, the most likely reason is a lapse in protocol. Hospital acquired infections, also known as healthcare associated infections, are a significant problem in facilities throughout Kentucky and Ohio. The FDA had to issue a list of recommendations about how to properly sterilize the equipment and the rooms where these HCDs were used, which indicates that the bacteria are being spread from person to person. Since NTM normally do not spread in this way, there must be some kind of direct contact.
<h2>Signs and symptoms of non-tuberculous mycobacteria</h2>
Most NTM infections present with flu-like symptoms, including:
<ul>
    <li>Fatigue</li>
    <li>Fever</li>
    <li>Nausea</li>
    <li>Vomiting</li>
    <li>Night sweats</li>
    <li>Muscle pain</li>
    <li>Weight loss</li>
</ul>
Some people may also experience swelling and tenderness in their skin, and may see pus or discharge.
<h2>Why are doctors failing to diagnose NTM in patients?</h2>
NTM may incubate inside of a person for years before that person exhibits any symptoms. If you underwent surgery six years ago, and then go to the doctor for relief from what you think is the flu, that doctor may fail to diagnose the problem.

However, the CDC and FDA has been issuing safety warnings about possible contamination since 2015 &#x2013; yet hospitals throughout Ohio and Kentucky are only now sending out letters that point to potential infection. It is worth asking what it took them so long to warn their patients that they could be harboring deadly bacteria.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we protect the rights of people who have sustained injuries or developed illnesses because of defective medical devices. If you or your loved one developed a potentially deadly infection after a procedure with a Sorin/ St&#xF6;ckert 3T heater-cooler device, we want to help. To speak with a skilled medical negligence attorney, call our Kentucky team at 877-686-8879, our Ohio team at 877-686-8879, or fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Why Doctors Must Obtain Informed Consent Before Operating
BASENAME: doctors-must-obtain-informed-consent-operating
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 04/28/2017 09:30:12 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6102" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/informed-consent-204x300.jpg" alt="informed consent" width="204" height="300">Doctors and hospitals have a duty to inform their patients about the benefits and risks of any treatment or medical procedure. Patients rely on health care providers to explain the known health risks. If a doctor or hospital fails to properly inform a patient, they can be sued for medical malpractice. Patients, except in certain emergencies, have the right to decide what risks they are going to take with their body, even if the treatment or procedure is likely to improve their health.

According to the <a href="https://www.ama-assn.org/sites/default/files/media-browser/code-of-medical-ethics-chapter-2.pdf">American Medical Association</a>, there are six key informed consent considerations. Patients have a right to know the following:
<ol>
    <li>The diagnosis of their condition or illness &#x2013; if known</li>
    <li>The reason for the proposed treatment, procedure, or surgery</li>
    <li>The pros and cons of each treatment or medical procedure</li>
    <li>What alternatives are available</li>
    <li>The benefits and dangers of the alternatives</li>
    <li>What is likely to happen if the patient declines to undergo the treatment or procedure</li>
</ol>
<h2>There are exceptions:</h2>
In some cases, doctors can proceed without informed consent or can get consent from people other than the patient:
<ul>
    <li>Parents or guardians must be informed and give consent for minor children.</li>
    <li>If a life-threating emergency exists and you are not mentally or physically able to give consent, medical professionals should generally proceed with treatment.</li>
    <li>If the patient is not mentally able to give informed consent, a family member or guardian may give consent in the patient&#x2019;s place.</li>
</ul>
The best way to advise the patient is by putting the benefits and risks of each possible treatment in writing and getting the patient to sign it. In Ohio, a patient needs to sign a consent form, unless he or she is not mentally or physically capable of doing so. In Kentucky, patients do not have to sign the paper to give consent. A patient can give also give oral consent. Consent may also be implied from circumstances, such as if an emergency arises during a surgery. If the patient does consent to the surgery, then it is implied that the doctor can try to save the patient&#x2019;s life during the operation if unexpected circumstances arise. The doctor must still proceed according to reasonable medical standards. Consent is not a license to make mistakes.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, our Kentucky and Ohio medical malpractice attorneys demand compensation for any medical bills, lost wages, and pain and suffering the patient endures because they were treated against their wishes. For strong advocacy when physicians act against your interest, please call our Kentucky lawyers at 877-686-8879 or our Ohio team at 877-686-8879. You can also arrange to speak to us through our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Essential Components of a Medical Malpractice Claim
BASENAME: essential-components-medical-malpractice-claim
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/16/2017 02:14:46 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6094" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/components-of-medical-malpractice-claim-300x300.jpg" alt="components of medical malpractice claim" width="300" height="300">Patients trust health providers to be competent at their job, to be properly trained, to make a correct diagnosis, and to prescribe the right treatment for their medical problems. Any health provider who provides negligent care that injures a patient can be sued for medical malpractice. Health providers include doctors, hospitals, nurses, medical technicians, emergency health providers, and anyone who counsels or treats the patient. Medical malpractice is a legal term of art that has precise requirements. Experienced Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys understand which requirements apply for their respective states.
<h2>The key elements of a medical malpractice claim</h2>
In order to hold the health provider liable for negligence or malpractice, each of the following items must be proved:
<ul>
    <li><strong>The establishment a doctor-patient relationship.</strong> Usually, the relationship can be demonstrated by the forms and admissions papers patients sign before the health provider sees the patient.</li>
    <li><strong>Showing that the health provider did not meet the appropriate standard of care.</strong> This requirement has two parts:
<ul>
    <li><strong>The standard of care for the doctor or hospital.</strong> The standard is the amount and types of skill that a prudent doctor with reasonably careful similar training would have. Family doctors are compared to similar family doctors. Neurosurgeons are compared to similar neurosurgeons. Family doctors are not required to have the skill of a neurosurgeon, however. This is a lot of legalese for saying, &#x201C;What procedures and treatments would a similarly trained doctor have provided?&#x201D;</li>
    <li><strong>How the provider failed to meet the standard of care. </strong>A qualified medical witness must then explain how specifically the defendant failed to meet the standard of care that was expected.</li>
    <li><strong>Proximate cause.</strong> It must be shown that the negligence of the doctor, the below-standard care, caused the patient physical harm.</li>
    <li><strong>Harm to the patient.</strong> Here, the medical witness will normally explain what injuries the patient sustained, what medical steps need to be taken to improve the patient&#x2019;s condition and maintain his/her health, and what physical pain and emotional suffering the patient will endure &#x2013; and for how long.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
A major reason for employing the highly skilled medical malpractice lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law is that we have the resources and network to retain medical professionals who understand your injuries, or those of a loved one, and who know how to present the medical testimony in court. For help with your medical malpractice claim or that of a loved one, please call our Ohio lawyers at 877.686.8879 and our Kentucky attorneys at 877.651.7764. You can also contact us through our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Multiple Tractor-Trailer Crash Backs Up Ohio Turnpike
BASENAME: multiple-tractor-trailer-crash-backs-ohio-turnpike
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/12/2017 01:01:19 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6097" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/ohio-truck-accident-300x182.jpg" alt="ohio truck accident" width="300" height="182">In January 2017, <a href="http://wkbn.com/2017/01/27/3-semi-trucks-crash-on-ohio-turnpike-in-boardman/" target="_blank">WKBN First News 27</a> reported that a chain-reaction truck accident occurred on the Ohio Turnpike when a semi-truck overturned, causing three other tractor-trailers to collide in their attempt to avoid the overturned semi. The accident happened around 2:30 am, shutting down one of the eastbound lanes for a good part of the morning. At least one person was transported to a hospital. Police from local departments and a hazardous materials crew were called out to clear the roads and clean up the diesel fuel spilled from the trucks.
<h2>Why large trucks rollover</h2>
The most common reason for an 18-wheeler, commercial truck, van, or other truck rollover is going too fast through a curve. The physical size and dimensions of a truck make them much tougher to control than a smaller vehicle when speeding through a turn. Trucks also have a different center of gravity than cars, making them more susceptible to rollovers. Truck drivers who fail to slow down around a curve should be held accountable for any injuries they cause. The owners of the truck and any truck companies that improperly pressured the truck driver to go too fast for conditions should also be held liable for deaths and physical injuries.

Other reasons trucks rollover include:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Brake failure.</strong> Here, the manufacturer of the brakes can be held responsible.</li>
    <li><strong>Over-steering.</strong> This is normally due to the failure of the driver to pay attention and then overcompensate when a traffic danger arises.</li>
    <li><strong>Drunk or distracted driving.</strong> Both can cause the driver to lose control of the truck.</li>
    <li><strong>Faulty loading of the cargo.</strong> Cargo that is not properly secured, or that is too heavy or large for the truck, can shift while the truck driver is operating the truck, causing the operator to lose control or causing the center of gravity of the truck to shift.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Dangers to other drivers when a truck overturns</h2>
When a truck rolls over, the driver and any passengers of surrounding vehicles that are hit can die or suffer catastrophic injuries, such as traumatic brain injury or spinal cord damage. Other drivers and passengers on the road can be injured as they attempt to navigate around the overturned truck if they collide with other vehicles, strike road barriers, or flip over themselves.

When trucks rollover, their cargo is likely to spill. Spilled cargo can strike oncoming vehicles in the windshield or other parts of the car. The vehicle occupants can also be hurt as they attempt to avoid the spilled shipments. If the cargo has hazardous material, that material can ignite, causing complete havoc and multiple tragedies.

Truck overturn cases are very complex because the truck flip is normally just the start of a chain reaction of lethal events. Sorting out responsibility requires the experienced of highly skilled Ohio truck accident lawyers. For help with any truck accident case, please phone Crandall &amp; Pera Law&#x2019;s Ohio office at 877.686.8879 or use our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a> to make an appointment.

&#xA0;

--------
AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Sorin St&#xF6;ckert 3T Heater Cooler Devices are Endangering Heart Bypass Patients
BASENAME: sorin-stockert-3t-heater-cooler-devices-endangering-heart-bypass-patients
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/09/2017 02:46:32 PM
-----
BODY:
The <a href="https://www.cdc.gov/hai/outbreaks/heater-cooler.html" target="_blank">Centers for Disease Control and Prevention</a> (CDC) is currently telling cardiologists and hospitals that heater-cooler devices used during heart surgery pose risk for serious medical complications. The dangers exist because many of these devices may have been contaminated in the manufacturing process.

The risks include life-endangering infections, weight loss, fatigue, unexplained fever, aches, and night sweats. The primary device that has the CDC and the health community alarmed is the PLC St&#xF6;ckert 3T heater-cooler device (HCD) made by LivaNova, previously called the Sorin Group Deutschland GmbH. About 3/5 of all heart bypass surgeries in Ohio and Kentucky use a Sorin /St&#xF6;ckert 3T heater-cooler.

Heater-cooler machines are used during heart bypass surgeries to keep the blood and organs of the cardiology patient at just the right temperature. The CDC indicates that bacterial infection is a risk during any heart procedure. The use of the HCD increases that risk. In particular, the heater-coolers are known to risk an <em>M. chimaera</em> infection, which is caused by the water tanks the device uses to monitor the temperatures.

<strong>Read more</strong>
<ul>
    <li>Aggressive Kentucky Defective Device Attorneys Protecting Victims of Heater-Cooler Associated Infections</li>
    <li>LivaNova St&#xF6;ckert 3T Contaminated Heater-Cooler Device Causing Increased Risk of Infections Following Cardiothoracic Surgery</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.patientsrightsblog.com/contaminated-stockert-livanova-3t-heater-cooler-devices-can-increase-infection-risk-open-heart-surgery/" target="_blank">Contaminated St&#xF6;ckert LivaNova 3T Heater-Cooler Devices Can Increase Infection Risk After Open Heart Surgery</a></li>
    <li>What the Sorin 3T Contamination Debacle Means for Infected Patients</li>
</ul>
<h2>Why you may have a medical malpractice case</h2>
The dangers posed by these devices are serious. Individuals who have been harmed can bring claims against all responsible parties, including:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Sorin, LivaNova, and all related entities involved in the manufacture and sale of the defective heater-coolers</strong>. These product liability claims are brought on the theory that the device is defective and that the defect is causing serious harm and endangering lives.</li>
    <li><strong>The doctors who use the defective devices.</strong> Doctors can be sued for medical malpractice for failing to use alternative heater-coolers, now that the dangers of Sorin heater-coolers are well known, and also for failing to take proper sanity precautions. The physicians can also be held liable if they fail to fully inform the patient of the risks of using the device and if they do not obtain an informed written consent, even if the risks are disclosed verbally.</li>
    <li><strong>The hospital where the heart bypass was performed.</strong> Hospitals can be held liable on the same medical malpractice grounds as their doctors. They can be found responsible for not fully informing their doctors of the dangers of the HCDs or for failing to supervise their doctors responsibly.</li>
</ul>
The manufacturers of the Sorin heater-cooler can also be found liable if they were negligent or if they breached any express or implied warranties.

If you are suffering, or a loved one died due to a defective Sorin/St&#xF6;ckert 3T heater, our product defect lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can explain if you have grounds for a claim. For answers to your questions and strong legal advocacy, please phone our lawyers in Ohio at 877.686.8879, our Kentucky attorneys at 877.651.7764. You can also schedule an appointment through our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Highway 641 North Truck Underride Accident Injures a Kentucky Driver
BASENAME: highway-641-north-truck-underride-accident-injures-kentucky-driver
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/19/2017 10:08:59 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6092" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/kentucky-truck-accident-300x225.jpg" alt="kentucky truck accident" width="300" height="225">KFVS Channel 12 reported that on February 3, 2017 a 55-year-old Kentucky driver, Keith Brown, was injured when his vehicle rear-ended a semi-truck and trailer on Highway 641 North in Kentucky. The accident happened near Max Hurt Drive while the semi-truck was stopped at a red light. Mr. Brown&#x2019;s vehicle was partially pinned under the trailer. The Murray Police Department, Murray Fire Department, a local emergency medical service, and other state and local agencies helped extricate Mr. Brown so he could be flown to Vanderbilt Hospital for medical care.
<h2>The dangers of truck underride accidents</h2>
Large trucks, such as semis, have a high clearance area under the body of the truck. Many cars that rear-end this type of truck slide under it because the hood of the car is lower than the clearance height. Even the roofs of some cars can slide under the truck, pining the entire car. Often, the hood or windshield will shear off the car, causing additional dangers for any occupants of the smaller vehicle. Cars who strike a large commercial truck from the side can also slide under the truck&#x2019;s carriage.

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) does require that commercial trucks have rear-underride guards. The guards are supposed to stop cars from sliding under the truck. There are no NHTSA standards, though. The quality of the guards is dependent on the manufacturer and which vendor the truck owner uses. The NHTSA does not currently require side guards.

Truck underride accidents can cause death, traumatic brain injuries, broken bones, amputations, and other life-threating and long-term physical harm. Damages in these types of crashes include payment of all hospital and doctor bills, lost wages, pain and suffering, scarring and disfigurement, and other expenses such as medications. If the truck owner failed to have guards on the truck, punitive damages can also be sought.

Even though the car driver rear-ended the truck, the trucking company and the manufacturer of any guard rails on the truck may be liable for turning what should have been a minor accident into a major one.

If you were hurt, or someone you know was killed due to a truck underride accident, the Kentucky truck accident lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law have the experience you need. We have the resources and skills to hold all responsible parties accountable for wrongful death and serious injuries. For help now, please call us at 877.651.7764. You can also fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml" target="_blank">contact form</a> to make an appointment.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Steve Crandall Admitted to Practice in the United States Court of Federal Claims
BASENAME: steve-crandall-admitted-practice-united-states-court-federal-claims
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/23/2017 03:07:44 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-5861" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Screen-Shot-2017-05-23-at-1.06.09-PM-300x138.png" alt="Steve Crandall Admitted to Practice in the United States Court of Federal Claims" width="300" height="138">Crandall &amp; Pera Law would like to congratulate co-founder Steve Crandall, who has been admitted to practice in the U.S. Court of Federal Claims. The CFC is the modern incarnation of the oldest Court in American history (established in 1855). There are 16 judges, nominated by the President, who serve for 15-year terms. Unlike other courts in the civil justice system, the CFC does not convene juries; rather, decisions are made by the judges themselves in what is known as a &#x201C;bench trial.&#x201D;

The <a href="http://www.uscfc.uscourts.gov/about-court" target="_blank">Court makes rulings</a> in cases where citizens have claims against the U.S. government, and &#x201C;is authorized to hear primarily money claims founded upon the Constitution, federal statutes, executive regulations, or contracts, express or implied in fact, with the United States.&#x201D; Because its jurisdiction reaches throughout the country, it hears cases throughout the U.S.
<h2>Claims under the National Childhood Vaccine Injury Act</h2>
Because Steve Crandall is now admitted to practice in the CFC, he is able to represent clients seeking compensation under the National Childhood Vaccine Injury Act of 1986. This &#x201C;Act establishes the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program under which individuals may bring claims for alleged vaccine-related injuries or deaths&#x201D; in <a href="http://www.uscfc.uscourts.gov/faqs" target="_blank">front of the Office of Special Masters</a>.

In layman&#x2019;s terms, this means that if you or your loved one was given a vaccine &#x2013; like a flu shot, or an MMR shot, for example &#x2013; that resulted in a severe allergic reaction, or that was found to be defective or dangerous in some way, you may be entitled to compensation from the VICP. Because these are federal claims in a special court, you must be represented by an attorney, like Steve Crandall, who has been admitted to practice in that court.

You can find the full list of covered vaccines here.

Crandall &amp; Pera Law is extremely proud of Steve for this accomplishment. Only a handful of attorneys from each state are admitted to practice in front of the U.S. Court of Federal Claims. It is a testament to his advocacy for, and dedication to, his clients&#x2019; best interests that he was admitted to practice in front of such a venerable Court. We offer a heartfelt &#x201C;congratulations,&#x201D; and believe that injury victims in Ohio and Kentucky can rest easier, knowing he is on their side.

&#xA0;

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Kentucky Truck Driver Killed in Collision with an Amtrak Train
BASENAME: kentucky-truck-driver-killed-collision-amtrak-train
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/26/2017 12:52:56 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6088" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Amtrak-train-300x225.jpg" alt="Kentucky Truck Driver Killed in Collision with an Amtrak Train" width="300" height="225">A 74-year old man was killed in Greenup County when a traveling <a href="http://www.wsaz.com/content/news/Train-and-vehicle-collide-in-Greenup-County-Ky-420795503.html" target="_blank">CSX train hit his truck</a>. The truck driver was crossing the railroad tracks when the impact of the crash caused the truck to end up in the front yard of a nearby house. The police indicated that the lights and gates at the crossing appeared to be in working condition. None of the 73 passengers on the Amtrak train were injured, though they were delayed for several hours as police investigated the accident.
<h2>Accidents involving mass transit vehicles result in complex claims</h2>
Cases like this one begin with an investigation by the police who are called to the train accident location. In train crashes, the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will also be alerted to the crash and will conduct an investigation. The goal of this investigation is to determine fault, as well as to prevent future accidents from happening.

Kentucky truck accident lawyers hired to represent victims will employ their own investigators to speak with witnesses, review the reports of the police and the NTSB, and to conduct their own review of the accident site. In appropriate cases, the lawyers may also hire an accident reconstruction expert to determine fault.

In this type of case, the investigation will be two-fold. The first part of the review will be to examine the liability of the driver. Did he stop before entering the tracks? Was he intoxicated, distracted, or fatigued? Was he speeding, or otherwise in violation of traffic safety laws?

The second half of the investigation will be focused on determining if the site of the accident itself had a part to play in causing the accident. Considerations include:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Previous injuries at the train site. </strong>Prior accidents at this site would indicate the crossing may not have been maintained properly and that someone should have done the necessary maintenance.</li>
    <li><strong>Inspection reports of lights and guard crossings</strong>. The apparatus at the train crossing should be regularly inspected to ensure proper functioning.</li>
    <li><strong>The site itself may have been poorly designed</strong>. Trucks and vehicles should have warnings that train tracks are a short distance away. The crossing should be visible and not hidden by trees, bushes, or other obstructions.</li>
</ul>
In this case, the only known victim is the deceased. If Amtrak or any other entities were responsible for the accident, the family of the deceased truck driver would have the right to bring a wrongful death action against the responsible companies.

Families of deceased drivers sometimes believe they do not have a case. However, the Kentucky truck accident lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law thoroughly investigate these cases to ensure your family receives justice. &#xA0;If your spouse, parent, or child was killed or suffered a catastrophic injury, retain competent counsel to advocate on your behalf. Crandall &amp; Pera Law can help you get justice. To make an appointment, please phone us at 877.651.7764 or fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: State and Federal Efforts to Limit Damages in Medical Malpractice Cases
BASENAME: state-and-federal-efforts-to-limit-damages-in-medical-malpractice-cases
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 06/06/2017 11:49:07 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6083" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/unconstitutional-1-300x199.jpg" alt="damage caps on malpractice cases" width="300" height="199">Pending legislation seeks to compromise the rights of medical malpractice victims, preventing them from obtaining just compensation for their injuries. This is most apparent in federal law, HR 1215, which proposes that non-economic damages be capped at $250,00 for any medical malpractice claim that involves a federal program, tax benefit, or subsidy.

This federal legislation has not been passed to date, but states are beginning to follow suit. A recent <a href="http://www.radioiowa.com/2017/05/05/iowa-law-caps-non-economic-damages-in-medical-malpractice-suits/" target="_blank">law</a> that was passed in Iowa limits victims&#x2019; ability to obtain full justice for negligent and irresponsible conduct by doctors and hospitals. Now, when Iowa children and families suffer any type of physical or mental harm&#x2014;except in cases causing catastrophic disability or death&#x2014;the doctors and hospitals responsible will only have to pay a maximum of $250,000 for non-economic damages, such as pain and suffering.
<h2>Why the new Iowa law and others like it are so hurtful to innocent victims</h2>
Iowa Governor Terry Branstad signed the new medical damage reduction law even though the Governor and the Iowa Congress are fully aware that it does nothing to protect medical malpractice victims who suffer harm through no fault of their own. The fault for their injuries lies with negligent doctors who were poorly trained, fatigued, made an improper diagnosis, or otherwise failed in their duty of care. Iowa&#x2019;s new law caps pain and suffering losses at $250,000 unless the patient dies, loses major bodily functions, or becomes substantially disfigured.

The potential for inadequate compensation to victims is just one issue that makes this law so troubling. What&#x2019;s more, the law does nothing to deter doctors from making the same mistakes and hurting other patients.
<h2>HR 1215 poses heightened threat to malpractice victims nationwide</h2>
Iowa&#x2019;s new medical malpractice cap is just the tip of the iceberg. HR 1215 involves, at minimum:
<ul>
    <li>A $250,000 federal limit applied to all medical malpractice cases, regardless of how severe the injury is.</li>
    <li>Protection for doctors and hospitals who give defective drugs to patients, even if they are jointly responsible for the patient&#x2019;s death or injury.</li>
    <li>Severe limits on legal fees, which directly threatens the ability to bring a medical malpractice claim.</li>
</ul>
The U.S. Congress is also working to end class-action lawsuits, which protect patients by holding drug and medical device manufacturers accountable for putting profit ahead of product safety.
<h2>Read more about tort reform restrictions</h2>
To learn more about the federal effort to limit your ability to obtain sufficient pain and damage awards when you suffer a serious or catastrophic injury, we invite you to read more here:
<ul>
    <li>HR 1215 &#x2013; Congressional Tort Reform Designed to Destroy Your Rights</li>
    <li>The ABA Stands With Patients: HR 1215 is Dangerous</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.patientsrightsblog.com/h-r-1215-aims-stifle-victims-rights-medical-malpractice-cases/" target="_blank">R. 1215 Aims to Stifle Victim&#x2019;s Rights in Medical Malpractice Cases</a></li>
    <li>Tort Reform in Ohio &#x2013; Good for Rapists, Bad for Victims</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.patientsrightsblog.com/h-r-1215-aims-stifle-victims-rights-medical-malpractice-cases/" target="_blank">The Trouble With Tort Reform</a></li>
</ul>
Injured victims deserve full compensation for their injuries. Our Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law are dedicated to fighting these new laws so innocent patients can have the quality of life they deserve. For help with any doctor, hospital, or healthcare negligence claims, please call us at 877.651.7764 in Kentucky, 877.686.8879 in Ohio, or fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Cephalohematoma: When Birth Injuries Look Like Child Abuse
BASENAME: cephalohematoma-birth-injuries-look-like-child-abuse
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 06/02/2017 12:46:29 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6085" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/birth-injuries-300x200.jpg" alt="birth injuries" width="300" height="200">Does any parent have a greater nightmare than being unfairly accused of harming his or her own child? Unfortunately, this nightmare scenario is a reality for some parents of children who have suffered a ruptured blood vessel in their skull during a traumatic or difficult birth.

Known as cephalohematoma, this condition affects <a href="http://mddk.com/cephalohematoma.html" target="_blank">1 in 50</a> infants in the US. Rather than being a biological problem, cephalohematoma is caused by the improper actions of medical practitioners during delivery, through the aggressive use of a vacuum or forceps. The majority of babies who suffer this injury during birth recover with no lasting damage in about three months. The damage is not to the brain itself, but to the skull and surrounding tissue. However, during the recovery process, the tissue damage looks nearly identical to the damage of other, more serious conditions, which can only be ruled out via radiography or CT scanning.

Not every case of cephalohematoma is resolved without issue. Some babies suffer more serious bleeding and require blood transfusions, and any infant with the condition is more prone to jaundice.&#xA0; In some cases, the condition accompanies a more severe skull fracture. Risk factors for developing a cephalohematoma include:
<ul>
    <li>Difficult or prolonged delivery</li>
    <li>Use of forceps or vacuum extraction</li>
    <li>Maternal vitamin C deficiency</li>
    <li>Large infant head size compared to maternal pelvis</li>
    <li>First pregnancy</li>
</ul>
It is the responsible of the physician to identify and anticipate these issues and take appropriate precautions. Failure to do so is a demonstration of negligence on the doctor&#x2019;s part.
<h2><strong><em>This birth injury can mimic the symptoms of abuse</em></strong></h2>
Some parents may not be aware that their babies have a cephalohematoma until a well-baby visit or other medical assessment. In the Virginia case of <a href="http://wset.com/news/local/mom-charged-with-child-abuse-claims-medical-records-prove-injuries-happened-at-birth" target="_blank">Crystal Good,e</a> that is exactly what happened. Rather than recognizing the bump and surrounding bruise as a relatively innocuous cephalohematoma, her pediatrician called the police, and Goode was charged with felony child abuse. Testimony was given that the injury was consistent with a fall from at least three stories or a high-speed car accident. Birth records, however, clearly indicate that Goode&#x2019;s infant suffered a cephalohematoma during delivery. Unfortunately, Goode pleaded guilty prior to these records being checked, and still faces a sentence of two to 10 years in prison. While she is currently free on bond, Goode is not allowed to have unrestricted access to the baby or her other four children.

If your infant has suffered a cephalohematoma during delivery, contact the experienced Kentucky and Ohio birth injury lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law. Our attorneys work to get you and your child the compensation you deserve. For a free consultation, call our Kentucky legal team at 877.651.7764, our Ohio legal team at 877.686.8879, or <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact us</a> today.

&#xA0;

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Ohio Interstate in Flames When a Wrong-Way Driver Smashed into an Oil Tanker
BASENAME: ohio-interstate-flames-wrong-way-driver-smashed-oil-tanker
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 05/30/2017 02:39:51 PM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6079" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Oil-Truck-Accidents-300x200.jpg" alt="oil truck accident" width="300" height="200">According to a recent <a href="http://abc13.com/news/wrong-way-crash-sparks-massive-tanker-explosion/1939295/" target="_blank">report</a>, a 30-year old driver was observed driving down Interstate 75 in the wrong direction earlier this month. His vehicle crashed into to a tanker truck, causing a spectacular explosion. The wreck was caught on film and showed that the collision caused a huge fireball. The driver going the wrong way was killed. The driver of the tanker was fortunate to escape the incident with minor injuries. Officers had to let the fire run its course before they could apply foam and begin to manage the Interstate. Traffic had to be shut down in both directions at parts of the Dayton Interstate, and a hazardous materials unit was called to the accident scene.
<h2>Liability issues in this type of case</h2>
The driver may have been going the wrong way for several reasons &#x2013; each of which could have caused the collision. Some of the issues an experienced Ohio truck accident lawyer would explore are:
<ul>
    <li><strong>Was the driver intoxicated</strong>? Anyone who operates a vehicle while drunk suffers compromised control of his mental and physical abilities. Seriously intoxicated drivers may fail to realize they are driving on the wrong side of the road until it is too late. When a driver is killed at the accident site, a blood test, if possible, may be used to determine blood alcohol level. The driver&#x2019;s whereabouts before the crash can also be investigated.</li>
</ul>
The family of the driver may have a wrongful death dram shop claim against any vendor that served the wrong-way driver liquor. The key elements of an Ohio dram shop violation are that the person was visibly intoxicated, yet the vendor continued to serve that person alcoholic drinks.
<ul>
    <li><strong>Was the driver distracted? </strong>Texting while driving, talking on a smartphone, eating, personal grooming, fatigue, or any other distraction could have resulted in the driver ending up on the wrong side of the roadway.</li>
    <li><strong>Was the driver negligent?</strong> Since there is no right reason for going the wrong way down an interstate, the driver is certainly liable for his own his careless and reckless conduct.</li>
</ul>
The truck driver who was injured and the trucking company whose truck and cargo went up in flames would have the right to bring a claim against the driver&#x2019;s estate. They would also have the right to assert a dram shop violation against a vendor who served a visibly intoxicated driver.

If you or a loved one was injured in any type of collision with a truck, the lawyers at Crandall &amp; Pera Law can help. Our Ohio truck accident lawyers understand why such accidents happen, how to prove fault, and how to determine liability for any type of accident. For help now, please call 877.686.8879 or complete our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a> to schedule an appointment.

AUTHOR: Crandall Pera Law
TITLE: Florida High Court Rules Damage Caps Unconstitutional
BASENAME: florida-high-court-rules-damage-caps-unconstitutional
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 0
CONVERT BREAKS: 1
ALLOW PINGS: 0
DATE: 06/13/2017 09:50:32 AM
-----
BODY:
<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-6076" src="https://www.injuryverdicts.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/unconstitutional-300x199.jpg" alt="damage caps unconstitutional" width="300" height="199">On June 9, 2017, the Florida Supreme Court struck down an old law that placed caps on damages a person could recover for injuries suffered due to medical malpractice. Ruling that the limit on non-economic damages violated the equal protection provisions of the state constitution, the Florida high court voted 4-3 to overturn the 2003 law which was passed to curb an alleged &quot;medical malpractice crisis,&quot; although the crisis never occurred.

The so-called medical malpractice crisis was nothing but a fabrication on the part of doctors and hospitals who live in fear of being sued, according to a story in the <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2016/12/30/top-republicans-say-theres-a-medical-malpractice-crisis-experts-say-there-isnt/" target="_blank">Washington Post</a>. The <em>Post</em> story reports that &quot;Doctors are paying less for malpractice insurance than they did in 2001,&quot; and that the &quot;rate of claims has dropped by half since 2003.&quot;

Florida has made a smart move in abolishing non-economic damages caps, but now federal law would limit non-economic damages.
<h2>HR 1215 is dangerous to victims</h2>
HR 1215, <em>The Protection of Access to Care Act of 2017</em>, says that its purpose is to &quot;improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system.&#x201D; But what it really does is take away your rights to a jury trial, and it would limit the amount of compensation an injured person can collect in a medical malpractice lawsuit to $250,000 regardless of the extent of the injury. Here is a link to the <a href="https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr1215/text" target="_blank">full text of HR 1215</a> and a <a href="https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr1215/summary" target="_blank">summary</a> of the proposed bill.

Given that preventable medical mistakes are now the third leading cause of death in the U.S., laws like this one would destroy any incentive for the health care industry to improve quality and safety for patients.

<strong>Read more:</strong>
<ul>
    <li>THE ABA STANDS WITH PATIENTS: HR 1215 IS DANGEROUS</li>
    <li>H.R. 1215: CONGRESSIONAL TORT REFORM DESIGNED TO DESTROY YOUR RIGHTS</li>
    <li>NEW BILL WOULD REMOVE EFFECTIVE CHECKS ON MEDICAL MALPRACTICE</li>
    <li>STATE AND FEDERAL EFFORTS TO LIMIT DAMAGES IN MEDICAL MALPRACTICE CASES</li>
    <li>TORT REFORM IN OHIO: GOOD FOR RAPISTS, BAD FOR VICTIMS</li>
</ul>
<strong>From the Patients&#x2019; Rights Blog:</strong>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://www.patientsrightsblog.com/h-r-1215-aims-stifle-victims-rights-medical-malpractice-cases/" target="_blank">H.R. 1215 Aims to Stifle Victim&#x2019;s Rights in Medical Malpractice Cases</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.patientsrightsblog.com/tort-reform-damage-caps-protect-hospitals-not-patients/" target="_blank">Tort Reform and Damage Caps Protect Hospitals, Not Patients</a></li>
</ul>
<a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28346582">A study</a> that analyzed data from the National Practitioner Data Bank (NPDB) has found that paid medical malpractice claims across all specialties have fallen 55.7% from 1992 to 2014. If the so-called medical malpractice crisis never materialized, why must we create federally-mandated tort reform?

We will continue to encourage our readers and clients to <a href="http://www.house.gov/representatives/find/" target="_blank">contact your representatives</a> as HR 1215 may be up for a vote this week. Get informed on the issue and let your elected officials hear what you have to say.

At Crandall &amp; Pera Law, we believe that injured victims deserve full compensation for their injuries. Our Ohio and Kentucky medical malpractice attorneys at Crandall &amp; Pera Law fight to make sure that innocent patients can have the quality of life they deserve. For help with any type of healthcare negligence claim, we encourage you to call us at 877.651.7764 in Kentucky, 877.686.8879 in Ohio, or fill out our <a href="/Contact.shtml">contact form</a>.
